Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The Union Cabinet today cleared revised pay scales for nearly eight lakh teachers and academic staff of higher education institutions following the implementation of the Seventh Pay Commission. The approved pay scales would be applicable from January 1, 2016. The revised pay package will cover teachers of 119 centrally funded technical institutions like IITs, IISc, IIMs, IISERs, IIITs, and NITIE.

This decision will benefit 7.58 lakh teachers and equivalent academic staff in the 106 universities and colleges which are funded by the UGC and the union HRD ministry and also 329 universities which are funded by state governments and 12,912 government and private aided colleges affiliated to state public universities.
Source- http://economictimes.indi...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 12-10-2017 at 05:21PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The Union Cabinet today cleared revised pay scales for nearly eight lakh teachers and academic staff of higher education institutions following the implementation of the Seventh Pay Commission. The approved pay scales would be applicable from January 1, 2016. The revised pay package will cover teachers of 119 centrally funded technical institutions -- IITs, IISc, IIMs, IISERs, IIITs, and NITIE.

This decision will benefit 7.58 lakh teachers and equivalent academic staff in the 106 universities and colleges which are funded by the UGC and the union HRD ministry and also 329 universities which are funded by state governments and 12,912 government and private aided colleges affiliated to state public universities.
Source- http://economictimes.indi...

  • Posted on 12-10-2017 at 01:17PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) has been signed by IIT Kharagpur with Samsung India for setting up a digital academy on the Institute's campus. The department of CSE will be hosting the Samsung Innovation Lab and training the students on the Internet of Things (IoT), which would help them to be "job ready". The course will be taught over 14 weeks through classroom lectures, assignments, mini projects, etc.

Source: http://economictimes.indi...

Technology Robotix Society

Hey Freshers!

Here's the component list for the Hardware Hackathon for Line Following Robot to be held on Sunday. Do get the components at the earliest from Chaudhari's in Tech Market!

1. IC7805 Voltage Regulator - 1
2. L293D Motor Driver - 1
3. IR Module - 2
4. 300-500rpm DC Motor - 2
5. Battery 9v-12v - 1
6. PCB - 1
7. Chasis - 1
8. Castor wheel - 1
9. Wheels - 2
10. Battery connector - 1
11. Solder iron - 1
12. Solder wire - 1
13. IC Bed for L293D - 1
14. Jumpers (male to female) - 6

  • Posted on 12-10-2017 at 12:15AM

Alumni Cell

"Know Your Alumni"-E3:
Students' Alumni Cell presents its new series 'Know Your Alumni' where it will bring up interviews, blogs and posts about the extraordinary alumni of IIT Kharagpur to you.
In E-3, we have Anuradha Acharya and Subhash Lingareddy, founders of Ocimum Bio Solutions and Mapmygenome.
Anuradha Acharya is the founder and was the CEO of Ocimum Bio Solutions, a genomics outsourcing company for discovery, development and diagnostics, headquartered in Hyderabad, India from 2000 to 2013. She was awarded Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum in 2011.
Subhash Lingareddy is presently the President and CFO of Ocimum Biosolutions and also Founder at Mapmygenome.in. he received Beta Gamma Sigma Honor Society Award in 1996.
They talk about various ventures in their career and about the differences in US and Indian education....

  • View the post
  • Posted on 11-10-2017 at 10:59PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Happay, the new age business expense management solution provider started in 2012 by IIT-KGP graduates Varun Rathi and Anshul Rai, has announced clocking over one million transactions through the platform, with an astounding annual growth rate of 200 percent.

Currently, over 4000 businesses in India are managed through the Happay platform naming Aditya Birla Retail Ltd., Health & Glow, IBIBO Group, Uber, Urban Ladder, OYO Rooms, V Guard, and Unnati NGO. With an overall employee base of 250 across ten cities in India, Happay plans to double its employee strength and also onboard 10,000 enterprises by 2019.

Read what the founders believe of the future prospects in a market where they have already proven themselves as potential giants- http://www.india.com/news...

Spring Fest

Are you stressed about the mid semester exams that did not go well? Or about someone who ridiculed you for being fat? Are you really bogged down by the problems of your daily life? Even if you are not, there are people around you who actually are.

In our humble bid to give voice to those who prefer to keep quiet, we launch our Social Cause for Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur 2018, 'Umang' on the occasion of World Mental Health Day.

You can join us in our cause for mental health and show support by adding our ‘Umang’ frame to your profile picture. You can send us your experiences and suggestions at https://2018.social.sprin... .

Come let us not ignore this stigma anymore but stand up to it and join our hands in this campaign for creating a beautiful world with beautiful minds!

#StandUpToStigma #Umang #SpringFest2018

Design Credits: Richik Raha
Videography: Parag Mhaiske, Pranay Narayankar, Akshay Choudhary
Content: Ankurjyoti Baishya, Arghyanil Bhattacharjee

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-10-2017 at 08:47PM
Spring Fest

Are you stressed about the mid semester exams that did not go well? Or about someone who ridiculed you for being fat? Are you really bogged down by the problems of your daily life? Even if you are not, there are people around you who actually are.

In our humble bid to give voice to those who prefer to keep quiet, we launch our Social Cause for Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur 2018, 'Umang' on the occasion of World Mental Health Day.

You can join us in our cause for mental health and show support by adding our ‘Umang’ frame to your profile picture. You can send us your experiences and suggestions at umang.sf18@ gmail.com .

Come let us not ignore this stigma anymore but stand up to it and join our hands in this campaign for creating a beautiful world with beautiful minds!

#StandUpToStigma #Umang #SpringFest2018

Design Credits: Richik Raha
Videography: Parag Mhaiske, Pranay Narayankar, Akshay Choudhary
Content: Ankurjyoti Baishya, Arghyanil Bhattacharjee

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-10-2017 at 08:30PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In the first decision of its own kind, IIT-Kanpur senate suspended 22 second-year B.Tech students, yesterday, as a punishment after junior students filed a complaint to the Dean of Student Affairs against seniors, saying they were thrashed, abused, and forced to do inhuman acts. The probe committee had found the charges to be true, and recommended the suspension of all 22 students.
"Sixteen students have been suspended for three years and six others for one year,” said Mr. Manindra Agarwal, Deputy Director of IIT Kanpur. In addition, the president and other office bearers of the student gymkhana were removed from their respective posts allegedly for ignoring the complaints as per the reports by Hindustan Times. The suspended students would not have the right to go for a mercy appeal during the suspension period.

Source: http://www.hindustantimes...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-10-2017 at 07:49PM
Autonomous Ground Vehicle

A workshop was conducted on 7th and 8th October for the students of AGV, sponsored by Nugenix. The workshop was taken by Mr Lentin Joseph, who is the Founder of QboticsLabs and Roboacademy. He is also one of the most renowned author of books like "ROS Robotics Projects", "Mastering ROS" and "Learning Robotics".

AGV IIT Kharagpur extends its vote of thanks to Mr Aditya Marathe and Mr Lentin Joseph for the successful conduction of the workshop. These are some of the glimpses of the workshop.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The Indian Institutes of Technology seem on the verge of witnessing a protest very soon. This time not by the students but by the faculty members! Yes, Teachers at the Indian Institutes of Technology are set to hold a protest for the first time against the NDA government over its delay in announcing a revised pay package although an expert panel had recommended a revision nearly six months back.

The All India IIT Faculty Federation, which represents nearly 4,000 members, has given the call for the token protest. The last time IIT teachers had protested over pay scales was in 2010 when the UPA was in power. The AIIITFF has written to all the faculty forums at every IIT to hold the protest on Tuesday for an hour from around 5.30pm after working hours. In its communication to the faculty forums, the federation is learnt to have said that the implementation of the seventh pay commission was getting delayed and colleagues across the country were genuinely concerned.
Source: https://www.telegraphindi...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-10-2017 at 09:12PM

11th Oct | 6:30pm | V3/V4 (tentative)

Branding And Relations Cell

NDLI - the National Digital Library of India is now equipped with a whopping 1.26 crore of journals, e-books and magazines. All thanks to the 9k+ institutions who have registered with the NDLI team to get their study resources digitized. IIT Kharagpur, as always, has been the driving force behind this noble endeavour. The institute strives to make knowledge easily available to people all over the world on any topic. NDLI is a humble effort to achieve this cause. It has downloadable Android and IOS mobile apps. Already there have been more than 60 lakh downloads. So what are you waiting for? Go and get NDLI at your fingertips. To know how, read the link below.
http://www.millenniumpost...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-10-2017 at 06:15PM
Branding And Relations Cell

AIESEC

Announcing to the world, the man who will lead AIESEC in IIT Kharagpur in 2018, Hari Pranav K

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-10-2017 at 12:34PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

A workshop on ” Introduction to the History of Science In Ancient India” will be organized by the Department of Humanities and Social Sciences from Friday (13/10/2017) to Sunday(15/10/2017). The venue is Nalanda Complex, NR-121. The course is conducted by three eminent scholars, Dr. Michel Danino (a lifelong student of Indian
civilization and has authored papers and books in French and
English), Prof. K Ramasubramanian (Ph.D. in Theoretical
Physics, Bachelor's degree in Engineering and
a Masters in Sanskrit and Currently, Professor at the Cell
for Science and Technology in Sanskrit, IIT Bombay) and Dr. Clemency Montelle (Associate Professor in the School of
Mathematics and Statistics at the University of Canterbury,
Christchurch, New Zealand).
Registration fees are as follows:
IIT Kharagpur Students / Research Scholars – Rs.150/-
IIT Kharagpur Faculty – Rs.200/-
Non-IIT Students: Rs.1000/-
Non-IIT Faculty / or other Professionals: Rs.2000/-
Payment Method –
For IIT KGP Students and Faculty – pay to Dr. Anuradha Choudhary in S304Q, Department of Humanities and Social Sciences, on 9th -11th Oct between 5.30-7.00pm
For Out-station participants – Payment with registration between 5.30 -6 pm at Venue: Nalanda Complex - NR121
Last date of receipt of application/registration form: October 10, 2017
Contact person: Dr. Anuradha Choudhary. Ph: +91 9880739482
The in-depth details about the schedule, topics that will be cover in the workshop and registration form is in the link below - https://drive.google.com/...

We have a team of senior KGP students contributing in different target domains and we are looking forward to inviting new enthusiasts. Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

A workshop-cum-cultural programme on ‘Stress Management’ through ‘Sahaja Yoga Meditation’ was organised on Saturday evening at TOAT, IIT Kharagpur by Sahaja Yoga Organisation. The Guest of Honour, Professor Somesh Kumar, Dean (SA) and the Convener, Mr Anirudha Saha (Judge, Jhargram) inaugurated the programme by lightening the lamp. Professor Somesh Kumar introduced the need of Sahaja Yoga Meditation especially for the students to achieve the true excellence in their lives.

“We talk about ‘Atmavishwas’- the self-confidence and ‘Atmasamman’- the self-respect but do we ever think about ‘Atma’ itself?”, with these words, Mr Anirudha Saha underlined the human’s association with the pervading energy in the universe and advocated the regular practice of Sahaja Yoga for the Human Resource Development as well as Management.
Mr Anurag Kushwaha who presently works at DRDO, New Delhi and has been practising Sahaja Yoga Meditation for 15 years, delivered a presentation discussing on how we can achieve the thoughtless awareness through ‘Sahaja Yoga’ leading towards the eternal happiness. He also discussed the science of this method which serves to get back the control over the dormant energy (Kundalini) that resides within ourselves.

The workshop also comprised of cultural performances conveying the art as an indispensable part of Yoga. Mr. Deepak Sharma, a Kathak dancer from the prestigious Lucknow Gharana and his daughter Aarshi Sharma presented stellar dance performances followed by a Rajasthani folk dance staged by Sarita Srivastava. Mr. Deepak Verma, a renowned singer, chanted Bhajans with Mr. Pradyut Kumar Pal playing the Tabla and both creating a delightful environment in the amphitheatre.

Sahaja Yoga Organisation is to arrange for another workshop on Sahaja Yoga Meditation at TOAT, on Sunday at 5pm. Besides, similar sessions for meditation are to be held at Technology Staff Club every Sunday at 10am. We urge the student community to actively take part in such workshops so that the efforts of the institution get repaid in the form of healthy lives of its students.
Those who are interested in Sahaja Yoga Meditation can find more information about the same, here: http://www.sahajayoga.org... /

  • View the post
  • Posted on 08-10-2017 at 10:30AM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prof. Siddhartha Das, Professor at the Department of Metallurgical & Materials Engineering has been selected for the "IIM - Distinguished Educator Award" by the Indian Institute of Metals. He will receive the award during the 55th National Metallurgists' Day celebration on 14th November 2017.

The IIM is over 60 years old premier professional Metallurgical Institute set up to promote and advance the study and practice of the Science and the art of making and treating of metals and alloys and to promote just an honourable practice in Metallurgical profession.

Prof. Das completed his Ph.D. from the University of Illinois, USA and joined the institute in 1997. He has also been a recipient of 2015 Extraction and Processing Division Technology Award, TMS, Warrendale, USA and is life member of many professional bodies which include Indian Institute of Metals, Materials Research Society of India, Powder Metallurgy Association of India, Tau Beta Pi, a national engineering honour society, USA and Sigma Xi, a national scientific research society, USA.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for future endeavours!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 08-10-2017 at 10:00AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prof. Siddhartha Das, Professor at the Department of Metallurgical & Materials Engineering has been selected for the "IIM - Distinguished Educator Award" by the Indian Institute of Metals. He will receive the award during the 55th National Metallurgists' Day celebration on 14th November 2017.

The IIM is over 60 years old premier professional Metallurgical Institute set up to promote and advance the study and practice of the Science and the art of making and treating of metals and alloys and to promote just an honourable practice in Metallurgical profession.

Prof. Das completed his Ph.D. from University of Illinois, USA and joined the institute in 1997. He has also been a recipient of 2015 Extraction and Processing Division Technology Award, TMS, Warrendale, USA and is life member of many professional bodies which include Indian Institute of Metals, Materials Research Society of India, Powder Metallurgy Association of India, Tau Beta Pi, a national engineering honour society, USA and Sigma Xi, a national scientific research society, USA.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor and wishes him all the best for future endeavours!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-10-2017 at 09:25PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Indeed a long journey! Sometimes shaky, sometimes steady. But a journey worth documenting!
From earning accolades like “The Nerve of KGP”, “The Voice of KGP”, and many more to always striving to deliver on the expectations in the best way possible, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur has come a long way, thanks to the unsung efforts of the league of Awaaz ex-chief editors and ex-editors and the current team members as well. This video recognises their efforts, albeit not all, as all those efforts along with the emotions and the craving for the betterment of KGP community is not too easy to depict. Watch out for how Awaaz has made impact in the campus; be it keeping KGP well-informed, or covering issues which need immediate attention from the administration as well (Security issue, Fee hike issue, Issue of cumbersome CV module last year), or running campaigns (Save Electricity Campaign, Clean KGP Campaign), or active reporting on passport bribery issue in the passport office resulting in immediate halt to such malpractices, and many more.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur has always been and will always remain committed to its objective of the betterment of KGP community and sticking to the core values of Constructive journalism. Thank you KGP for all the love and support!

मीडिया' को लोकतंत्र का चौथा स्तम्भ माना जाता रहा है, और माना भी क्यों न जाए? जब सवाल नहीं पूछे जाएँगे तो फिर बिगड़ते काम काज को सुधारने की आवाज़ कौन उठाएगा या जब चीज़ें सही हो रही होंगी तो उसकी प्रशंसा कर उसे लोगो तक कौन पहुँचाएगा?

कहते हैं विचारों को आप मार नहीं सकते; सही ही है| साथ ही जब तक मीडिया और पत्रकारिता का अस्तित्व बचा रहेगा तब तक ये विचार द्रुत गति से फैलते रहेंगे | आज हम ऐसे समय में जी रहे हैं जब वैचारिक असहिष्णुता आम हो गयी है और ऐसे में ज़रूरत होती है एक जागरूक, बेचैन और साहसी तबके की जो हर किस्म की नाइंसाफियों पर बेबाकी से बोले और समाज के हित में पहलुओं का विश्लेषण करे |

आज से दस वर्ष पूर्व खड़गपुर में जब ऐसे तबके की ज़रूरत महसूस हुई तब स्थापना की गयी उत्साह से लबरेज एक टीम की - 'आवाज़', जिसका उद्देश्य था कि वह कैंपस के जन जन की आवाज़ बन जाए | पत्रकारिता में विचारों की जंग होती ही रहती है; पत्रकार का काम ही है कि वो हर पहलू को दिखाए, और इन दस सालों में न जाने हमने कितने महत्त्वपूर्ण पड़ावों को पार किया, न जाने कितनी मुश्किलें झेलीं और आलोचनाएं तो समय समय पर लगी ही रहती हैं |

खैर, आलोचनाएं इस बात का प्रतीक हैं कि हमें ग़म्भीरता से लिया तो जा रहा है, और इनसे प्रेरित होकर हम लगे रहे, और इतिहास इस बात का साक्षी रहा है कि हमने सूरत को बदलने की कोई कसर न छोड़ी | साल दर साल बीतते गए, पर अपने KGP जनता के हित में हमने हरसम्भव मदद करने की कोशिश की | GC से लेकर प्लेसमेंट्स तक- हर खबर का हर पहलू आप तक पहुँचाया गया |

हम वैसे समय में हैं जहाँ पत्रकारिता में हाथ घुमाकर अपनी ही पीठ थपथपाने का प्रचलन बढ़ गया है क्योंकि जनमानस का उत्साहवर्धन क्षीण पड़ता जा रहा है, और हमें गर्व है हमारी टीम पर, टीम के भूतपूर्व सदस्यों पर, टीम को सतत मार्गदर्शन देने वाले शिक्षकों पर और सबसे बढ़कर आप पर, क्योंकि आप ही से तो हमारा वजूद है | हम सभी एक बार पुनः आप सभी जनों का आभार प्रकट करते हैं और आशा करते हैं कि आगे भी यह सहयोग बना रहेगा |

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-10-2017 at 08:28PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Cycle repair shop in Nalanda or Fruit juice centre at Jnan Ghosh?
Yeah! Now, you have an opportunity to let your suggestions be heard. There seems to be a need for some basic amenities (shops etc.) at some public places in the campus that we don't have right now. And if they will be there, it would cater to the needs of all the KGPians.
This is an important survey aimed at getting all your suggestions so that suitable and reasonable suggestions can be forwarded to the administration and can be acted upon further.
Do read all the instructions carefully given in the form. Fill up the form by the noon of 10th October. Responses after that will not be entertained.
Link: https://goo.gl/forms/xAIt...

  • Posted on 07-10-2017 at 07:26PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

A “Stress Management programme” is being organized by SAHAJA YOGA MEDITATION. It is scheduled to be held on 7th October (today) from 5:00 pm - 8:00 pm at Tagore Open Air Theatre.
Admission to this programme is open to all. This activity can help all of us to alleviate stress-related problems and illness including depression. It makes one achieve a better work-life balance and establishes peace, joy and satisfaction. Please make the best use of this opportunity.
The schedule for this programme is as follows:
5:00 – 5:05 pm - Welcome of Chief Guest & all new seekers by Convenor.
5:05 – 5:20 pm - Candle lighting by Chief Guest Prof. S.K.Bhattacharya, Deputy Director & Guest of Honour Prof. Somesh Kumar, Dean Students affairs, IIT Kharagpur.
5:20 – 5:25 pm – Introduction about programme & Sahaja Yoga by Mr. Anurag
Kushwaha (DRDO).
5:25 – 5:45 pm – Cultural Programme (classical dance & Devotional Songs).
5:45 – 6:35 pm – Stress Management workshop through meditation.
6:35 – 7:40 pm – Cultural Programme (Devotional Songs & classical Dances).
7:40 – 7:45 pm – Questions and answers session.
7:45 – 8:00 pm – Concluding speech & vote of thanks by Secretary.
All the students are requested to attend this programme.

  • Posted on 07-10-2017 at 01:22PM
Technology Students Gymkhana

Have you ever wondered how a global investment bank like Goldman Sachs uses the knowledge and skill of smart people like you to drive some of the most cutting edge innovations in the field of finance?

We bring to you GS Quantify 2017, an exciting computer science, quant and machine learning contest, where you will be tested on real-world problems from different areas of quantitative finance and analytics. The problems are hand-picked by us to give you a flavor of what we do every day, and demand an understanding and application of topics like optimization, linear algebra, stochastic calculus, data mining, algorithms, data structures and many more.

Join us for GS Quantify and compete against the best minds across the best engineering and science schools and stand a chance to win exciting prizes like iPhones, iPads, etc. Top teams get an all-expense paid trip to the Goldman Sachs Bengaluru office to present their solutions.

To read more about the previous edition of GS Quantify, please visit our Blog on GS Quantify 2016 Blogpost.

Eligibility Criteria:
- Open to students of all years
- Maximum of 3 participants per team
REGISTRATIONS NOW OPEN!! EXCITING PRIZES TO BE WON!!

Last date for registration – October 7th

For more information and registrations, logon to hackerrank.com /gs-quantify-2017" target="_blank"> https://www.hackerrank.co...

For any queries, write to us at gs-quantify-2017@hackerrank.com

Feel free to spread the word with your fellow students.
Below is the link of the article that featured GS Quantify.
http://economictimes.indi...
We look forward to your participation!

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Below is the link to the complete live coverage of the HR Conclave 2017 being conducted by the Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur today on 7th October(Saturday) from 2 pm to 4:30 pm in Kalidas Auditorium. A moderated panel discussion is going to be held on the topic- "Harmonizing with the Disruption Economy: Emotional, Cultural and Generational Intelligence" which would aim at answering questions regarding constantly changing the business scene with a focus on disruption and its impact on Human Resources.

India

Corporation

Technology Robotix Society

Hey, 1st and 2nd years!

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in learning more advanced concepts of robotics, namely Autonomous Robotics and Image Processing. The workshop is conducted in two phases, the first one is for students who aren't attending EAA camps in the first week of December and the second one is for those who are.

Attendance in KRAIG classes is not compulsory to attend the Winter Workshop but is recommended.

We are releasing the tentative dates of the workshop so that the interested students may book their tickets in advance.

Phase 1: 1st December to 7th December
Phase 2: 9th December to 15th December

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-10-2017 at 01:41AM
Technology Robotix Society

Hey, 1st and 2nd years!

Technology Robotix Society conducts an IEEE certified Winter Workshop every year for 1st and 2nd years interested in learning more advanced concepts of robotics, namely Autonomous Robotics and Image Processing. The workshop is conducted in two phases, the first one is for students who aren't attending EAA camps in the first week of December and the second one is for those who are.

Attendance in KRAIG classes is not compulsory to attend the Winter Workshop but is recommended.

We are releasing the tentative dates of the workshop so that the interested students may book their tickets in advance.

Phase 1: 2nd December to 8th December
Phase 2: 10th December to 16th December

  • View the post

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Do you know that a KGPian is one of the project team members of the MIT Hyperloop team who won the SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition Design phase held in January 2016 and member of its Electrical sub-team which integrates the electrical subsystem into the pod? And currently, he is working in the Low Voltage Electronics Integration team of Tesla! He graduated in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Kharagpur (2010-14) with a staggering CGPA of 9.63 which fetched him the “President of India Gold Medal” for the highest CGPA among the graduating batch. Not only that, he also received “Dr. B.C. Roy Memorial Gold Medal” for being the best all-rounder student in the graduating batch. He went on to pursue his Master's Degree from MIT (GPA of 5/5) and worked as a Research Assistant at the Sloan Automotive Laboratory, MIT.
This genius is none other than Mr. Lakshya Jain who has made us all proud with his accomplishments at world stage! And it was just a matter of time before he was going to feature in our column "Jewels of KGP".
Mr. Lakshya talks about his school days, passion for mechanical engineering, interest in automobiles, internship experiences, extra-curricular activities, education at MIT, work at Hyperloop, time management, hobbies, advice etc. Give this article a read.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/la...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 06-10-2017 at 06:45PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prof. Sudip Misra, Associate Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been elected as a fellow of the National Academy of Sciences, India (NASI) for the year 2017. He completed his Ph.D. from Carlton University, Canada and joined the institute in 2007.

Prof. Misra has already been recipient of several prestigious awards and honours which include Samsung Innovation Award (2014), Young Systems Scientist Award, Systems Society of India (SSI) (2010), Alexander von Humboldt Fellowship (Germany) (2010), The National Academy of Sciences, India – Swarna Jayanti Puraskar (2008) and many more.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates him for this feat and wishes him all the best for future endeavours!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 06-10-2017 at 02:33PM
Entrepreneurship Cell

Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur is organizing a Workshop on Entrepreneurship Promotion. Professor Larry Cox of Pepperdine University ( USA ) will conduct this workshop.

It is a two-day workshop with timings as below:

9th of October: 6 pm - 8.30 pm
10th of October: 6 pm - 7.30 pm

The components of the workshop include Increasing Creative Capacity and Creative Problem Solving Process. Professor Larry Cox has expressed interest in sponsoring the travel to USA for few students of IIT Kharagpur in connection with Product and Entrepreneurship Promotion based on certain criteria that would be decided after these interactions.

Please fill out this form ( http://tinyurl.com/ecell-... ) by 10 am on 7th October 2017. Selected people will be intimated by email by 7th October 2017 itself.

Students will get participating certificate and are all invited for the high tea at the closing on each day. Please note that the attendance is compulsory for both(9th and 10th October 2017) days.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 06-10-2017 at 01:26PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Prof. Suman Chakraborty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, also serving as the Head of School of Medical Science and Technology (SMST) and Associate Dean at Sponsored Research and Industrial Consultancy (SRIC), IIT Kharagpur has been elected as Fellow of the American Physical Society (APS), a unique recognition in this field.
He joined the institute in 2002. He already has many awards and honours to his name including the highest scientific honour from the Government of India i.e., Shanti Swaroop Bhatnagar Prize (2013) and Scopus Young Scientist Award (2008). His research area includes Microfluidics and Nanofluidics, Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) etc. He has been the pioneer to agglomerate the science of microscale fluid mechanics with the complex biophysics of cells. He has also been the first researcher to develop a fundamental theory on the electrokinetic transport of blood through microfluidic conduits. He has about 340 research papers to his name, accepted by reputed journals
Earlier this year, in April, we had a talk with Prof. Chakaraborty where he had discussed his journey, engineering, Ph.D., hobbies etc. Give it a read here: http://awaaziitkgp.org/su...
.
American Physical Society (APS) is the world's second largest organization of physicists. The Society publishes more than a dozen scientific journals, including the prestigious Physical Review and Physical Review Letters, and organizes more than twenty science meetings each year.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him for this feat and wishes all the best for future endeavours!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 06-10-2017 at 09:40AM

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-10-2017 at 09:31PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

What do you see in this picture? KGP Water Polo team collecting their Runners-up trophy and medals in the recently concluded Inter IIT Aquatics Meet. Right? But it's more than what meets the eyes! They were collecting it with heavy hearts, with a bit gloomy emotions all around, bit dejected and feeling not-so-good about not being able to win the final. But what did actually happen?
They outplayed IIT Guwahati by 11-0, beat the favourites i.e., host IIT Madras by 5-4 and drew valiantly with IIT Bombay by 4-4. In semifinal, they made a mockery of it by winning it with a score of 10-2.
In finals, they were lagging behind with a score of 2-3. And not to forget, they were two times defending champions! Chips were down. The chances of winning the gold again looked bleak. But that's exactly when they bounced back in style to make a stunning comeback and levelled the score! It went down to penalties. They were still in the game and did a brilliant job by holding the opposition on tie, given that opposition had one of the best goalkeepers of the tournament. It then went down to 'sudden death' and they lost it by just a whisker!
Does the story end here? No, certainly not! They gave it their everything, every ounce of energy that their body had, every drop of sweat that they could have offered and showcased indomitable will, grit, determination and strength! It was the culmination of hours long practice sessions and rigorous training schedules.
And it's not only the Water Polo team, it has been the same with all other members of our contingent. They all have tried their best and left no stones unturned in bringing laurels to KGP. Be it silver or bronze or even no medal, it's not the medals for which they deserve applause, it's their sincere efforts that deserves tonnes of pats on their backs!
Let's take a moment and appreciate what they have achieved and accomplished. Let's applaud their collective efforts irrespective of what's the colour of the medal.
We all KGPians are indeed proud of you all, team KGP! Well done!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-10-2017 at 09:31PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

What do you see in this picture? KGP Water Polo team collecting their Runners-up trophy and medals in the recently concluded Inter IIT Aquatics Meet. Right? But it's more than what meets the eyes! They were collecting it with heavy hearts, with a bit gloomy emotions all around, bit dejected and feeling not-so-good about not being able to win the final. But what did actually happen?
They outplayed IIT Guwahati by 11-0, beat the favourites i.e., host IIT Madras by 5-4 and drew valiantly with IIT Bombay by 4-4. In semifinal, they made a mockery of it by winning it with a score of 10-2.
In finals, they were lagging behind with a score of 2-3. And not to forget, they were two times defending champions! Chips were down. The chances of winning the gold again looked bleak. But that's exactly when they bounced back in style to make a stunning comeback and levelled the score! It went down to penalties. They were still in the game and did a brilliant job by holding the opposition on tie, given that opposition had one of the best goalkeepers of the tournament. It then went down to 'sudden death' and they lost it by just a whisker!
Does the story end here? No, certainly not! They gave it their everything, every ounce of energy that their body had, every drop of sweat that they could have offered and showcased indomitable will, grit, determination and strength! It was the culmination of hours long practice sessions and rigorous training schedules.
And it's not only the Water Polo team, it has been the same with all other members of our contingent. They all have tried their best and left no stones unturned in bringing laurels to KGP. Be it silver or bronze or even no medal, it's not the medals for which they deserve applause, it's their sincere efforts that deserves tonnes of pats on their backs!
Let's take a moment and appreciate what they have achieved and accomplished. Let's applaud their collective efforts irrespective of what's the colour of the medal.
We all KGPians are indeed proud of you all, team KGP! Well done!

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Have you ever wondered how a global investment bank like Goldman Sachs uses the knowledge and skill of smart people like you to drive some of the most cutting-edge innovations in the field of finance?
Goldman Sachs bring to you GS Quantify 2017, an exciting computer science, quant and machine learning contest, where you will be tested on real-world problems from different areas of quantitative finance and analytics. The problems are based on understanding and application of topics like optimization, linear algebra, stochastic calculus, data mining, algorithms, data structures etc.
To read more about the previous edition of GS Quantify, visit their Blog on http://www.goldmansachs.c...
Eligibility Criteria:
- Open to students of all years
- Maximum of 3 participants per team
REGISTRATIONS NOW OPEN!! EXCITING PRIZES TO BE WON!!
Last date for registration – October 7th
For more information and registrations, log on to hackerrank.com /gs-quantify-2017" target="_blank"> https://www.hackerrank.co...
For any queries, write to them at gs-quantify-2017@hackerrank.com
Below is the link of the article that featured GS Quantify.
http://economictimes.indi...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The inaugural edition of the "HR Conclave" is scheduled to be held on 7th October(Saturday) from 2 pm to 4:30 pm in Kalidas Auditorium. It is being organized by the Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur. The dress code for the event is Semi-formals. A moderated panel discussion is going to be held on the topic- "Harmonizing with the Disruption Economy: Emotional, Cultural and Generational Intelligence" which would aim at answering questions regarding constantly changing the business scene with a focus on disruption and its impact on Human Resources. The panel comprises of nation's top Business Leaders and Industry Stalwarts which includes:-
1) Mr. Amulya Sah: Director HR, Samsung R&D Institute,
India
2) Mr. Prateek Dubey: Director HR, IDFC Bank
3) Ms. Deepti Vij: Assistant Director, E&Y- GDS
4) Mr. Rajesh Hurkat: Head HR, Mattel India
5) Mrs. Kiran Bhatia Tandon: Head Talent Acquisition, Stryker
Corporation
6) Mr. Ayan Pal: Moderator, Author, Distinguished
Toastmaster, stellar communicator, and leader
Interested ones can fill this form:- https://docs.google.com/f...
For any queries, contact the undersigned:-
Halima Akhtar 9540353676 Harshil Agrawal 9428412397
Shubham 9758228124 Divya 9545812167

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-10-2017 at 06:57PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The inaugural edition of the "HR
Conclave" is scheduled to be held on 7th October(Saturday) from 2 pm to 4:30 pm in Kalidas Auditorium. It is being organized by the Vinod Gupta School of Management, IIT Kharagpur. Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The 33rd Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet, four days of aquatics extravaganza, conducted by IIT Madras, witnessed an enthralling performance by the participants. Here are the final results and summary of this meet.

The Final Standings are as follows:

Swimming: Men’s
1. IIT Madras (11 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 84 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 4 Bronze) - 29 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 3 Silver, 3 Bronze) - 26 pts
4. IIT Delhi (3 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 25 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 5 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 25 pts

Swimming: Women's
1. IIT Madras (3 Gold, 3 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 28 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 24 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 8 pts
5. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 5 pts

Water Polo:
Gold - IIT Kanpur
Silver - IIT Kharagpur
Bronze - IIT Madras

Top four finishers in Swimming from IIT Kharagpur:
Men’s
Kryalos Indresh: 100m Breaststroke (Silver), 200m Breaststroke (Silver), 50m Breaststroke (Silver)
Gitanshu Bhatia: 200m Backstroke(Bronze), 50m Backstroke (Bronze)
Shubham Pandey: 100m Freestyle (Silver), 50m Freestyle (4th position)
Pushpak Roy: 100m Backstroke (4th position), 50m Breaststroke (4th Position)
4 x 100m Medley Relay: Gitanshu Bhatia, Kryalos Indresh, Pushpak Roy, Shubham Pandey (Team Silver)

Women’s
Women’s 4x50m Freestyle Relay: Prutha Kale, Oindrila Saha, Barsa Majumder, Nastassja Rai (Bronze)
Prutha Kale: 50m Butterfly (Bronze), 50m Freestyle (4th position)
Oindrila Saha: 50m Butterfly (4th position)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates all the winners and gives a huge round of applause to all the participants who gave it all and left no stone unturned in bringing laurels to IIT Kharagpur.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-10-2017 at 08:40PM

Business Club

The World Bank, in its own words, has two ambitious goals:
“To end extreme poverty within a generation and boost shared prosperity”
The World Bank, ever since its establishment has been viewed as a beacon of hope to a developing nation’s faltering economy. How have the World Bank projects fared? Have they improved the living standards or robbed people of the basic resources they once had? Read on to find out.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet | Day 4 | Evening Session

||Swimming||

Men’s
Kryalos Indresh bagged Silver in Men’s 50m Breaststroke finals finishing his performance in flying colours with a sum total of 3 individual silvers in the meet. Pushpak Roy stood at the 5th place in the same event.
Shubham Pandey won Silver in Men’s 100m Freestyle and Gitu Bhatia secured Bronze in Men’s 200m Backstroke event.

Women’s
Nastassja Rai stood at 8th place in Women’s 100m Freestyle finals.

||Waterpolo||

Defending champions IIT Kharagpur bagged silver after a nail-biting final match against IIT Kanpur. After an exciting tie at 3-3, the match still stood tied after penalties and it was finally decided 'Sudden Death'.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners.

Stay tuned to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur for final updates and medal tally.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-10-2017 at 06:41PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet | Day 4 | Evening Session

||Swimming||

Men’s
Kryalos Indresh bagged Silver in Men’s 50m Breaststroke finals finishing his performance in flying colours with a sum total of 3 individual silvers in the meet. Pushpak Roy stood at the 5th place in the same event.
Shubham Pandey won Silver in Men’s 100m Freestyle and Gitu Bhatia secured Bronze in Men’s 200m Backstroke event.

Women’s
Nastassja Rai stood at 8th place in Women’s 100m Freestyle finals.

||Waterpolo||

Defending champions IIT Kharagpur bagged silver in a nail-biting match against IIT Kanpur. After an exciting tie at 3-3, finally, the match was decided by the tiebreaker and then sudden death.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners.

Stay tuned to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur for final updates and medal tally.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-10-2017 at 05:18PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

IIT Kharagpur vs IIT Kanpur - Water Polo Final
Defending champions IIT KGP are taking on arch rivals IIT Kanpur in the finals of the Water Polo.
KGP is trailing by 2-3 at the moment.
KGP makes a comeback and levels the score by 3-3.
The match goes down to penalties now, indeed a nail-biting finish!
Still a tie!
It has now gone to 'Sudden Death'.
Kanpur's player shoots the ball, it hits the net and Kanpur wins the final!
Heartbreak for KGPians!
Well played team KGP! We all are proud of you all.

IIT Kharagpur vs IIT Kanpur - Water Polo Final
Defending champions IIT KGP are taking on arch rivals IIT Kanpur in the finals of the Water Polo.
KGP is trailing by 2-3 at the moment.
KGP makes a comeback and levels the score by 3-3.
The match goes down to penalties now, indeed a nail-biting finish!

The Scholar's Avenue

The Scholars' Avenue shared IIT KGP Sports's post.

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet, Madras:
Water Polo:
KGP 10 - 2 Roorkee
The defending champions made short shrift of IIT Roorkee, hammering them 10-2 in the first semi final today. With this win, KGP makes it into yet another final and will cross swords with the winner of the second semifinal, between Madras and Kanpur, today evening.

We congratulate our team on their victory and wish them all the very best for the final!
Your story, our trophy!

AIESEC

This film depicts the efforts of Om Prakash, a former bonded child labourer and International Children's Peace Prize laureate, who took the initiative to educate and give happiness to the poor children in Jaipur and nearby villages. Footprints is a National project that we at AIESEC run in India. Volunteers from around the world travel to India to contribute and make their contribution.The Goal number 4 from the 17 Sustainable Development Goals UN has for our world talks about "Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all". Read more here:http://www.globalgoals.org/global-goals/quality-education/
Credits: Shabbir Mohammed

#SDG4 #unitednations #sustainabledevelopment

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-10-2017 at 12:30PM
AIESEC

This film depicts the efforts of Om Prakash, a former bonded child laborer and International Children's Peace Prize laureate, who took initiative to educate and give happiness to the poor children in Jaipur and nearby villages. Footprints is a National project that we as AIESEC run in India, volunteers from around the world travel to India to contribute and do their bit towards this. The Goal number 4 from the 17 Sustainable Development Goals UN has for our world talks about "Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promote lifelong learning opportunities for all". Read more here: http://www.globalgoals.or...
Credits: Shabbir Mohammed

#SDG4 #unitednations #sustainabledevelopment

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 4
Water Polo
After a highly thumping win over IIT Roorkee by a margin of 10-2, the Defending Champions IITKGP are now one win away from the trophy.

Swimming
Our team comprising of Gitu Bhatia, Kryalos Indresh, Pushpak Roy and Shubham Pandey took home silver in the Men's 4X100m medley relay. Gitu Bhatia bagged a bronze in the Men's 200m backstroke event. Kryalos Indresh and Pushpak Roy qualified for the finals of Men's 50m breaststroke. Shubham Pandey qualified for Men's 100m freestyle finals while Nastassja Rai qualified for the Women's 100m freestyle finals. All the finals will be held today afternoon.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes our contingent all the best for finishing off the Inter IIT Aquatics Meet with accolades.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-10-2017 at 11:51AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 4
Water Polo
After a highly thumping win over IIT Roorkee by a margin of 10-2, the Defending Champions IITKGP are now one win away from the trophy.

Swimming
Our team comprising of Gitu Bhatia, Indresh, Pushpak Roy and Shubham Pandey took home silver in the Men's 4X100m medley relay. Gitu Bhatia bagged a bronze in the 200m backstroke event. Kryalos Indresh qualified for the finals of Men's 50m breaststroke. Shubham Pandey qualified for Men's 100m freestyle finals while Nastassja Rai qualified for the Women's 100m freestyle finals. All the finals will be held today afternoon.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes our continent all the best for finishing off the Inter IIT Aquatics Meet with accolades.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Professor Samit Kumar Ray, Professor at the Department of Physics, IIT Kharagpur has been elected fellow of the National Academy of Sciences, India (NASI) for the year 2017. He is also serving as the current Director of S.N. Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences, Kolkata.
Prof. S.K. Ray joined the institute in 1991. He already has several awards and honours in his kitty including MRSI-ICSC Superconductivity & Materials Science Annual Prize (2015) and INSA Young Scientist Award (1993). He is also a member of IEEE, USA.
The National Academy of Sciences, India was founded in the year 1930, with the objectives to provide a national forum for the publication of research work carried out by Indian scientists and to provide opportunities for exchange of views among them. The Academy undertakes several “science-society” programs under the guidance of its Presidents and Fellows.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates him and wishes all the best for future endeavours!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 03-10-2017 at 08:27PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 3 || Updates and Points Table
||Swimming||

Women's
The morning session saw IITKGP take home the bronze in 4X50m freestyle relay. The team members were Prutha Kale, Oindrila Saha, Barsa Majumder and Nastassja Rai. In the 50m freestyle event, Prutha Kale secured the fourth position and Oindrila Saha made it to the sixth spot.

Men's
Gitu Bhatia bagged bronze in the 50m backstroke event. In the finals of the 100m butterfly, Pushpak Roy bagged the fifth position. Shubham Pandey got the fourth spot in the 50m freestyle event.

||Waterpolo||
The league match between IIT Kharagpur and IIT Bombay ended in a draw with the scoreline reading 4-4. With this IITKGP sits pretty at the top of Group A and will meet the runner-up of Group B in the semifinals tomorrow at 10:30 am.

The current standings are as follows:
Men's
1. IIT Madras (8 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 64 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 2 Silver, 3 Bronze) - 25 pts
3. IIT Delhi (2 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 19 pts
4. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 3 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 19 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 2 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 10 pts
Women's
1. IIT Madras (3 Gold, 2 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 28 pts
2. IIT Bombay (1 Gold, 2 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 11 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 8 pts
5. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 5 pts
For complete results, please visit http://www.interiit.com/s...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and wishes all the best to our swimming contingent for the final day.

Pic: Bronze Winners in Women's 4X50m Freestyle Relay
Pic Courtesy: IIT KGP Sports

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet | Day 3

||Swimming||

Women’s

Women’s team consisting of Prutha Kale, Oindrila Saha, Barsa Majumder and Nastassja Rai secured Bronze in 4x50m Freestyle Relay.

Prutha Kale and Oindrila Saha qualified for 50m Freestyle finals to be held afternoon.

Men’s

Pushpak Roy qualified for 100m Butterfly finals, Gitu Bhatia qualified for 50m Backstroke finals, Shubham Pandey qualified for 50m Freestyle finals. All these finals are to be held afternoon.

||Waterpolo||

The match between IIT Bombay and IIT Kharagpur ended with a draw (4-4) and IIT Kharagpur is at the top of the points table in Group A with 7 points. With this, IIT Kharagpur is all set to play the semifinals tomorrow against the runner-up up of Group B.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners and wishes all the best to the qualifying participants for their finals.

KGP vs Bombay is live right now:

Final Score: 4-4.

While KGP has qualified already for the semis, it is a must win for Bombay if it wants to secure a seat in the semis, considering that Madras and Bombay have both won and lost a match each with Guwahati out of the running already.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

2nd Inter IIT Cultural Meet

Technology Students' Gymkhana has invited applications for overall vice-captains, cup-wise captain/vice-captain for the Inter IIT Cultural Meet to be held at IIT Kanpur from 28th to 30th December 2017. Details of each cup are provided in the link.( https://gymkhana.iitb.ac.in/~cultural/interiit/)
Eligibility: Students having at least 2 years of experience at IIT Kharagpur, except those sitting for upcoming placements (2017-18) are eligible.
Sample CV format is shown in the link (https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B-2KQCCDgrH-dzRTTHBKQ2hqeEhoVjZiWlNwZ19NdTMzWVY0)
All the applications (attach CV in PDF format) should be emailed to tsg.socult@gmail.com by 5th October 2017, 11:59 PM. The selections will be made on the basis of CV’s and Interviews(if needed).
The subject of Mail:
1.For Overall Vice captains
[OVERALL] APPLICATION FOR VICE CAPTAIN – NAME
2.For cup-wise captain/vice-captain:
[CUP NAME] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – NAME
e.g. [DRAMATICS] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – NAME

Credits: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur

  • Posted on 03-10-2017 at 01:45AM

Branding And Relations Cell

Four IIT Kharagpur alumni — Sachin Jaiswal, Keshav Prawasi, Nitin Babel and Shishir Modi have created a chatbot named Niki under their startup Techbins Solutions. The chatbot uses natural language processing and machine learning to allow users to order anything through the chat interface.
They raised $2 million in series A funding from investors like Mr. Tata.Its service is currently being used by more than 4,00,000 customers.

http://www.thehindu.com/b...

The Scholar's Avenue

The 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet ‘17 being held at IIT Madras was flagged off yesterday with a speech by Chief Guest Mr.Rehan Poncha, a five-time national champion and Arjuna Award winner, along with a diving performance and an act by Mr.Preveen Pandita, an illusionist.

With Day 2 almost coming to a close, KGP is giving its all to bring home the coveted cup. While the Water-Polo team is going strong with two wins, the Swimming team is having a tough time facing the stiff competition. Our current medal tally consists of a silver and bronze, bagged by the men’s and women’s contingents respectively. The finals of todays events are currently underway.

We’d like to throw some light on the general structure of the tournament. We have posted below a day wise consolidated list of the events in both the categorized events – Swimming and Water Polo.
The swimming events kick off early in the morning every day, with trials/heats held in the first half to screen the teams, out of which the top 8 contenders qualify for the finals of the respective events, which would be held in the later half of the day. This will continue for all the 4 days.
While on the other side, 4 Water Polo matches are held everyday – with each of the eight teams facing one opponent from their respective pools. The 4th day will witness the winners of each pool face the runners-up of the other pool respectively for the semifinal matches, the losers of these semis will fight for the 3rd place and the most awaited finals will be held thereafter.

We wish our KGP contingent the very best for the rest of the tournament and hope to see them shine brightly in every one of the events.

Stay tuned for more updates on the standings and results!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 02-10-2017 at 05:29PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 2 || Updates and Points Table

Waterpolo
Defending champions IIT Kharagpur beat the hosts and one of the favourites IIT Madras 5-4 in an epic underwater battle. IITKGP tops the points table of Group A with 6 points.

Swimming
In the morning session Prutha Kale opened the medal tally for IIT Kharagpur Women's Team with a bronze in 50m butterfly event while Oindrila Saha secured the fourth position in the same event. Kryalos Indresh bagged his second silver of the meet with his spectacular performance in Men's 100m Breaststroke event. Shubham Pandey secured the sixth position in Men's 50m Butterfly and Raj Prabhu also stood sixth in Men's 200m Freestyle event.

The current standings are as follows:
Men's
1. IIT Madras (5 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 49 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 1 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 19 pts
3. IIT Delhi (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 12 pts
4. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 11 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 2 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 7 pts
Women's
1. IIT Madras (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 10 pts
2. IIT Bombay (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 9 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
4. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
For complete results, please visit http://www.interiit.com/s...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 02-10-2017 at 05:29PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 2

Waterpolo
Defending champions IIT Kharagpur beat the hosts and one of the favourites IIT Madras 5-4 in an epic underwater battle. IITKGP tops the points table of Group A with 6 points.

Swimming
In the morning session Prutha Kale opened the medal tally for IIT Kharagpur Women's Team with a bronze in 50m butterfly event while Oindrila Saha secured the fourth position in the same event. Kryalos Indresh bagged his second silver of the meet with his spectacular performance in Men's 100m Breaststroke event. Shubham Pandey secured the sixth position in Men's 50m Butterfly and Raj Prabhu also stood sixth in Men's 200m Freestyle event.

The current standings are as follows:
Men's
1. IIT Madras (5 Gold, 3 Silver, 5 Bronze) - 49 pts
2. IIT Bombay (2 Gold, 1 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 19 pts
3. IIT Delhi (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 12 pts
4. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 11 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 2 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 7 pts
Women's
1. IIT Madras (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 10 pts
2. IIT Bombay (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 9 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 8 pts
4. IIT Kharagpur ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
4. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts
For complete results, please visit http://www.interiit.com/s...

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Let us introspect, for where we are heading, for whether we are happy having a holiday today or are trying to remember and follow these two great leaders. Let us not forget the lofty ideals that this day stands for. Let us pay tribute to Mahatma Gandhi and Lal Bahadur Shashtri and remember their teachings and the success they achieved with the force of non-violence.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet | Day 2 | Swimming

Women’s
Prutha Kale secured Bronze in 50m Butterfly, bagging the first medal for IIT Kharagpur in women’s category and Oindrila Saha stood at 4th place in the same event.

Men’s
Prabhu Raj qualified for Men’s 200m Freestyle finals, Kryalos Indresh qualified for Men’s 100m Breaststroke finals and Amlan Shil, Shubham Pandey qualified for Men’s 50m Butterfly finals. All these finals are to be held today in the evening.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes best of luck to the qualifying participants.

Technology Students Gymkhana

Hello All,

TSG invites applications for overall vice captains, cup-wise captain/vice-captain for INTER IIT CULTURAL MEET 2017(KANPUR, 28-30th Dec).Details of each cup are provided in the link.( https://gymkhana.iitb.ac.in/~cultural/interiit/)

Eligibility: Student having at least 2 years of experience at IIT Kharagpur, except those sitting for upcoming placements (2017-18).

Sample CV format is shown in the link (https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-2KQCCDgrH-dzRTTHBKQ2hqeEhoVjZiWlNwZ19NdTMzWVY0/view?usp=sharing)

(All the CV’s should be in this format and should be emailed in PDF format).
All the applications should be emailed to tsg.socult@gmail.com by 5th October 2017, 11:59 PM. The selections will be made on the basis of CV’s and Interviews(if needed).
The subject of Mail:
1.For Overall Vice captains
[OVERALL] APPLICATION FOR VICE CAPTAIN – NAME
2.For cup-wise captain/vice captain:
[CUP NAME] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – NAME
e.g. [DRAMATICS] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – SHUBHAM JAIN

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 1

IIT Kharagpur registered a thumping win over IIT Guwahati by 11-0 in water polo. Kryalos Indresh bagged a Silver in Men's 200m breaststroke and opened the medal tally for KGP. Pushpak Roy and Gitu Bhatia secured the fourth and fifth position respectively in Men's 100m Backstroke. Prutha Kale secured the fifth position in Women’s 50m Breaststroke.
The current standings according to the medal tally are:

Men's
1. IIT Madras (3 Gold, 1 Silver, 2 Bronze) - 27 pts
2. IIT Bombay (1 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 9 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 9 pts
4. IIT Delhi (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 6 pts
5. IIT Kharagpur (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 4 pts

Women's
1. IIT Madras (1 Gold, 1 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 10 pts
2. IIT Bombay (1 Gold, 0 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 6 pts
3. IIT Kanpur (0 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze) - 3 pts
4. IIT Roorkee ( 0 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze) - 3 pts

For complete results, please visit http://www.interiit.com/s...

  • Posted on 01-10-2017 at 06:14PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet || Day 1

IIT Kharagpur registered a thumping win over IIT Guwahati by 11-0 in water polo. Kryalos Indresh bagged a Silver in Men's 200m breaststroke and opened the medal tally for KGP. The current standings according to the medal tally are:
1.IIT Madras ( 4 Gold, 2 Silver, 3 Bronze)
2.IIT Bombay ( 2 Gold, 0 Silver, 1 Bronze)
3.IIT Kanpur ( 0 Gold, 2 Silver, 1 Bronze)
4.IIT Kharagpur and IIT Delhi ( 0 Gold, 1 Silver, 0 Bronze)

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The much-awaited Inter-IIT Aquatics Meet finally kicked off today. Our contingent is trying to leave no stone unturned to bag it.
Today, Indresh qualified for Men's 200m Breaststroke finals, Gitu Bhatia and Pushpak Roy qualified for Men's 100m Backstroke finals and Prutha Kale qualified for Women's 50m Breaststroke finals to be held in the afternoon session today. Oindrila Saha and Prutha Kale have qualified for the finals of Women's 50m Butterfly event to be held tomorrow.
Besides, Defending Champions IIT Kharagpur comfortably defeated IIT Guwahati 11-0 in Water Polo encounter.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the qualifying participants good luck for their final breakdown in the afternoon.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Inter IIT Sports Meet presents the first edition of the 'Back with a Splash', the daily newsletter for the 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet, 2017. The newsletter offers the readers The Story so far, Day 0 highlights, Know Your Teams, Today's Event Schedule and much more.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-10-2017 at 12:06AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The Inter IIT Sports Meet 2017, was inaugurated in a dazzling open ceremony at IIT Madras, with the 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics being the first event for the meet. Arjuna Awardee, 3 times national champion, distinguished Olympian and swimmer Mr. Rehan Poncha was the chief guest for the opening ceremony. He shared his vast experience in sports and encouraged the athletes for their active participation in the sports.
The Inter IIT Aquatics Meet that will span over 4 days comprises of 18 events. Over 200 participants from 11 IITs are participating in the mega event. Apart from the heats of some events, IIT Madras will witness the finals of 100m backstroke, 200m breaststroke, and 400m freestyle events for men and 50m backstroke and 50m breaststroke events for women today. In addition, IIT Kharagpur will face IIT Guwahati in a much-anticipated Waterpolo encounter at 12:00pm.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the athletes all the best.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 30-09-2017 at 09:57PM

Business Club

The Saudi Royal family has ruled a decision that may change the lives of millions of women in Saudi Arabia. The decision to let women drive is being praised by human rights activists and industries alike. It is not only a step towards equality for women in Saudi Arabia but also an opportunity for the automotive industry to explore more customers. However, as positive as it may seem, a decision helping thousands of women may hurt giant service providers like Uber. Read on to find out more.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 30-09-2017 at 09:00PM
Business Club

A big decision coming from the Saudi Royal family is definitely a life changing one for millions of women of Saudi Arabia. Hailing it a big success, the human rights activists think that it will make the women of Saudi Arabia more independent. On the other hand, the decision is being seen as an opportunity for the automotive industry. The decision has opened customers counting to almost half the population of the Gulf nation. Now that women can drive, the decision appears to be a threat for the cab hailing services like Uber which also suffered a major setback by its license suspension in London. Read on to find out the impact of the decision in the automotive industry in the country.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 30-09-2017 at 07:43PM

All the hackathon enthusiasts who are presently in Delhi and nearby areas are advised to attend first of its kind initiative by Government of India.

Branding And Relations Cell

IIT Kharagpur alumni have developed a social network for food lovers called Eatable. Eatable help you to connect with fellow foodies and post a review or suggestion about eateries. Eatable work on both mobile and desktop and is accessible all over India.
It gives a direct relationship between foodies and their place of preference since even eateries can post content themselves and their followers are notified in real time.

http://indiatoday.intoday...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-09-2017 at 07:11PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

|| Foreign Training Guide ||

Foreign Training (FT) is one of the most sought after opportunities for the students, especially those who are interested in pursuing research. Along with providing great research opportunities to the students, a Foreign Training Internship also helps them in inculcating leadership qualities and give an experience about new places and cultures.
By this time, students tend to start working on how to get an FT. However, many students are not well informed about how to begin with the process.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur presents to you all the basic guide on how to apply for Foreign Training and we hope that it will prove to be quite insightful as it has been for the previous batches.
This article provides the students an insight into the entire process of applying for Foreign Internship, either through Research Programs or through the regular process of mailing the professors in an efficient and streamlined manner.
We would also like to point out that one should not blindly go for an FT under the impression of just getting a good point to add to his/her resume. Students should also look into the research projects and similar opportunities at our own institute and get involved in them as well.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/ft...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-09-2017 at 06:59PM
Kshitij

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-09-2017 at 06:40PM
Kshitij

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur is back with the 2nd edition of its regional round Kascade, which will be conducted in the major cities across India.

Prelims of the flagship events Nightshift, Math Olympiad, Source Code and Anadigix will be conducted. Teams that will be shortlisted in the prelims will be guaranteed a direct entry in the final round to be held at IIT Kharagpur during Kshitij in 2018.

Stay tuned for more updates.

Technology Students Gymkhana

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post.

The Aquatics Contingent of IIT Kharagpur leaves today for the 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet at Madras. The women’s swimming team led by Prutha Kale is high on confidence and is looking to better their previous year’s performance, where they finished third. Gitanshu Bhatia leads the well primed and poised men’s swimming team, while the two time defending champions, our water polo team with Abhishek Dahiya at the helm is all set to bring that trophy back to where it belongs. IIT KGP Sports wishes them all the very best!
Your story. Our trophy. 🏆
#Go_For_Gold #MADrush!

TeamKART

Engineers are not superhuman. They make mistakes in their assumptions, in their calculations, in their conclusions. That they make mistakes is forgivable; that they catch them is imperative. Thus it is the essence of modern engineering not only to be able to check one's work but also to have one's work checked and to be able to check the work of others.
~Henry Petroski
#sanitychecks #becauseracecar #modernengineering

  • Posted on 27-09-2017 at 06:42PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Three alumni from IIT Kharagpur - Mainak Sarkar (Electrical), Pritam Khan and Sumit Agarwal (both Computer Science) along with fourth co-founder Abhijit Ghosh (Civil Engineering, IIEST Shibpur) have developed a social network-cum-utility platform for food lovers where they can connect with other fellow foodies and also their favourite eateries named 'Eatable'.
On this platform, users can connect with fellow foodies and share their experiences, recommend their favourite eating places to their friends and followers, and help add a place to the network’s database. It also allows eateries (restaurants, cafes, bars, pubs and others) from any location with internet access to join the platform and connect with their customers and keep them engaged and updated about all their activities in real time.

Source: http://www.hindustantimes...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 27-09-2017 at 05:13PM

  • Posted on 26-09-2017 at 02:50PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The administration is in the process of revamping the existing curriculum and offering its students a potentially state-of-the-art type of curriculum. The recently held Senate has decided to invite views from all the stakeholders in order to accommodate all possible suggestions and revise the curriculum for the academic year 2018-19 and beyond accordingly. In this regard, a feedback form has been designed by the consensus of UG Senate Representative and all UG council members. The link to the form is given below and the students are requested to fill the form before the deadline of 5th October 2017.
https://goo.gl/forms/7O94...
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur appreciates this move from the administration and urges the student community to actively be a part of this feedback mechanism by ensuring that you are filling it with seriousness and dedication. First and second year students might not have an idea about some of the queries related to projects, industry exposure, etc. and they can gather the information regarding it from relevant sources. All the students are requested to devote some time, suggest even the minute details and help the administration make the revamp a successful one. The fact that such revamp is happening after almost a decade and there are minimal chances that a big revamp would occur in near future after this, so everyone should make the best use of the opportunity and help IIT Kharagpur and upcoming generation of students reap the benefits of your experiences and ideas.
It is advisable to go through the academic curriculum of some of the elite universities and suggest accordingly. We must ponder over the question that why the courses on the educational platforms like coursera, edx, etc. seem to attract so many students and why we can’t make our courses interesting enough for the students to motivate them to attend the classes. Inputs from everyone among the student community matters. Here we provide some of the links to the course structure of some of the elite universities.
https://www.stanford.edu/...
http://catalog.mit.edu/su...
https://www.si.umich.edu/...
We hope that the administration also ropes in the alumni who have studied under the present curriculum and can give insights about how those courses are helping them in current situations and how the improvements can be brought forth.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 26-09-2017 at 02:13PM
Technology Students Gymkhana

Greetings from Dean (UGS) Office!

We are in the process of revamping the existing curriculum and in this connection recently held senate; it was decided to have views from all the stake holders about the revised curricula to be implemented from Academic Year 2018-19 which will be potentially state-of-the-art type of curriculum.

Kindly feel free to give your constructive critical inputs in the following form and be a part of this change.

The google form link is https://goo.gl/forms/7O94...

The deadline is 5th October 2017.

The Scholar's Avenue

Our institute is in the process of revamping the existing curriculum and in regards to this, in the recently held senate, it was decided to have views from all the stake holders about the revised curricula to be implemented from Academic Year 2018-19 which will potentially be a state-of-the-art type of curriculum.

In connection to this, with the help of the UG Senate Representative and all UG Students council members, they have designed a feedback form to have every candidate's opinion. Kindly feel free to give your constructive critical inputs in the following form.

The google form link is https://goo.gl/forms/7O94...

The deadline is 5th October 2017.

Personal Request from the Dean: Spread the word among your friends about the above mentioned information to have better perspective of your views on curriculum.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

|| 6th Inter IIT Tech Meet || Problem Statements

The 6th Inter IIT Tech Meet will be held from 05.01.2018 to 07.01.2018 at IIT Madras.
The problem statements for the events have been released and can be found in the link below. Interested students can send in their applications at tech.gymkhana@gmail.com after going through the problem statements. The application should contain the cover letter along with the student's CV. The subject of the mail should be [Problem Statement][Name][Roll No.].
Deadline: 03.10.2017, 12.30 AM
No applications after this deadline will be accepted under any circumstances.
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B4TlhthhU1diNXNRLS0zS2dsUFU
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes the tech-enthusiasts all the best and hopes that the students would utilise their Durga Puja Holidays in analysing the problems.
Credits: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

"सदियों की ठंढी-बुझी राख सुगबुगा उठी,
मिट्टी सोने का ताज पहन इठलाती है;
दो राह,समय के रथ का घर्घर-नाद सुनो,
सिंहासन खाली करो कि जनता आती है।"
-जनतंत्र का जन्म(26/01/1950)

उनकी लेखनी में जितनी उग्रता है, उतनी ही शीतलता भी है। एक ऐसे कवि जिन्होंने भारतवर्ष और उसके जनमानस की आशा, निराशा, प्रत्याशा, सब कुछ को अपनी लेखनी में समेटा और उनकी आवाज़ बुलंद की। भारतीयता और राष्ट्रीयता का पर्याय बन चुके हिंदी के प्रतिनिधि कवि रामधारी सिंह 'दिनकर' के जन्मदिवस पर उनको कोटि कोटि नमन।
उनकी लेखनी का अभूतपूर्व स्वाद www.kavitakosh.org/dinkar... से लिया जा सकता है। उनकी जीवनी और उनके लेखन के बारे में जानने के लिए ये वीडियो देख सकते हैं-- https://youtu.be/0qlM66a3...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 23-09-2017 at 11:26AM
Technology Students Gymkhana

कृपया सभी को सूचित करें कि आज 23 सितंबर 2017 को प्रस्तावित काव्य पाठ प्रतियोगिता कम संख्या में नामांकन आने के कारण स्थगित की जा रही है। आगे के आयोजन संबधी विवरण समय से फिर सूचित किया जाएगा। निवेदन है कि इस सूचना को सभी काव्य प्रेमियों एवं कविता पाठ के इच्छुक सभी को, सभी सोशल मीडिया समूहों में सूचित करें। सादर. डॉ राजीव कुमार रावत

Metakgp

With one more day to go in the present exam session, we hope you have had a good run. You can send your question paper to us, and we will upload it to MFQP. From now, until eternity, no one has to go into an exam hall clueless about what the questions will look like. Let's get together to make this a reality! Email images or a PDF of your question papers to metakgp-qp@ googlegroups.com

MFQP: https://qp.metakgp.org

P.S. It really helps if you can use the CamScanner app and send us a PDF generated by that app. We appreciate the time and effort you put into this :)

  • Posted on 23-09-2017 at 12:15AM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

A team of researchers at IIT Kharagpur has developed a solution to prevent hacking into the devices supporting the Internet of Things (IoT). With the products enabled with internet connectivity facilitating our lives, their security has also become a major concern. This method binds a Wi-Fi camera with its PUF (Physically Unclonable Function)-based identity, a solution of which is inevitable to connect with the receiver PC and thus depriving an attacker of the access to the PC. For more information, please visit the link: http://economictimes.indi...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-09-2017 at 03:00PM
Director IIT Kharagpur

http://www.business-stand...

  • Posted on 21-09-2017 at 09:19PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The IITs have revoked a ban, which they had imposed on 30 companies, mostly start-ups, barring them from participating in their campus placements.

The decision to revoke the ban was taken unanimously on Wednesday at a meeting of the All-IIT Placement Committee (AIPC).

The AIPC had blacklisted these companies, including healthcare services provider Portea Medical, food-tech company Zomato and online seller of baby-care products Hopscotch, in August 2016, after they withdrew the job offers they had made to the students.

Source: http://www.business-stand...

Entrepreneurship Cell

Google has announced that it will acquire TC corporation's smartphone division for $1.1 billion in an all-cash deal. The deal includes a transfer of about 2000 employees of HTC to Google.
In addition to the team, Google will also have access to HTC's intellectual property to support the Pixel smartphone family.

#EAD_2k17

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

|| Google Code Jam ||
As you might be aware, Google is conducting Kickstart 2017 ( https://code.google.com/c... ) (formerly known as the APAC University Test), a 2Code Jam competition for university students to improve their technical skills and apply for career opportunities with Google. The next round is scheduled for September 24th.

1) Prepare with a codelab (duration ~2-3 hours)
We've prepared a small codelab (a tutorial combining explanation, working example code, and code exercise) to cover some basic algorithms which will help in the upcoming Code Jam Kickstart (CJK) rounds. Even if you do not plan to participate in the upcoming rounds, the codelab should help brush up basics for other algorithmic contests and interviews.

For the codelab, you would need an internet connection and basic programming skills in a language of your choice, and of course, a little enthusiasm and energy to get through the codelab. We recommend having facilitators (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed, and pursue the codelab as a group exercise. If you're a facilitator, it would be nice to brush up some combinatorics, dynamic programming (DP) and geometry skills. The time it would take a student to finish the codelab would depend on their current understanding and skill, but to err on the safe side, be ready to put in 2-3 hours.

2) Sign-up for the Codelab by 20th Sep
Please sign-up via this form ( https://docs.google.com/f... ) and we will send you the codelab material via email. We recommend that you work on the codelab in groups so that it's both fun and you can learn from one another. And plan on having a facilitator (a faculty or a fellow student) who can help if needed.

Feedback/Questions
When we send the codelab via email, we will also send a link to a feedback form. Any concepts that are difficult or if you have questions about specific problems, please share/ask via the feedback form. We will address them as part of a livestream that we are hosting in the first week of October.

Post September 24th
We will host a Youtube livestream, in which we'll cover questions/concepts asked in the codelab exercise, discuss problems from a previous CJK round, common tips and tricks, strategies and general Q&A regarding CJK. We will share the livestream link with everyone who signs up for the codelab.
​
​Looking forward to an active participation.​
*We or similar pronouns refer to Google.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 18-09-2017 at 09:02PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The campus has seen a grave concern over LAN and WiFi speed from the beginning of this semester and recently, a petition regarding the same on change.org has also been doing rounds. And many students have also emailed their grievances to CIC. Here's what CIC Network Support team has replied with:

Dear All,
This is in connection with the recent performance of campus network, especially the response time of internet access. We have received some emails from students of different halls regarding the slow response of internet access. Our team also started visiting all Halls to check the response time via LAN as well as wireless. Depending on the problem observed we will take care all of them individually and try to sort out at the earliest.
In view of the above, you are requested to send emails regarding the network accessibility issues, slightly in details, observed in your Hall to helpdesk@cc.iitkgp.ernet.in. It may be in any particular wing/ rooms/area or may be in LAN/Wi-Fi in some of the rooms, mentioning room nos./contact nos. etc. It will help us to identify and solve the issues in each and every hall separately.

We hope that this issue will be resolved at the earliest! Students are requested to send emails stating their concern as directed above.

  • Posted on 18-09-2017 at 04:44PM
