The Scholar's Avenue

A petition regarding the poor internet speed in the campus on change.org is gaining traction and currently has a supporters' count of 935. This issue is certainly one which needs immediate action. One of the reporters in our team complained that in the library, the internet speed is so slow that it took 15 mins to sign the petition itself! This is a phenomenal example of the issue fighting the cause and not the other way around (and of bad humor too). Anyways, this is the link to the petition: http://chn.ge/2xcSfyJ

Debating Society

Escalation.

From quiet interruptions, the pace slowly quickens towards boorish rebuttals and personal attacks. Tempers rise, ready to explode at the drop of a hat. Slurs are heaped mercilessly and before you know it, there's kicking and scratching and a full scale brawl. Well, almost.

But that right there?
That is everything we are not. Join us, and you'll see for yourself.

Pro.Verb 2017.
Debating done right.

Register Now:
https://goo.gl/w8WB4r

For any queries:
Send us a mail at: proverbsoc@gmail.com

  • Posted on 16-09-2017 at 05:18PM

Spring Fest

Engineering Students- A unique race of students who know how to procrastinate and still manage things on time. These people can survive on maggi for a semester, and won't go near the mess of a Mess.

All heroes don't wear capes. Some wear a single shirt throughout the semester.

Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone a Happy Engineer's Day.

MidSems aren't 'a week away' anymore, they commence tomorrow!
So stop scrolling through your Facebook feed, it's never too late to start mugging.

  • Posted on 14-09-2017 at 10:49PM
Spring Fest

MidSems aren't 'a week away' anymore, they commence tomorrow!
So stop scrolling through your Facebook feed, it's never too late to start mugging.
Or maybe watch a few more episodes of your favorite TV series?
And let's not forget to print our Admit Cards.

PS: 'Don't try this at home.'

#MidSem #HappyMugging

Design- Amlan Kumar Sahu

  • View the post
  • Posted on 14-09-2017 at 10:15PM
Alumni Cell

The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavours to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental in organising the Annual Alumni Meet, Regional Student Alumni Meet, regular guest lectures by distinguished alumni in the campus, publishing the annual literary magazine (Yearnings of Yore) & the annual yearbook. The Students' Alumni Cell also operates the Student - Alumni Mentorship Programme, My Imprint (Giving Back - Alumni contribution), recently launched Alumni Career Assistance Program and organises Phonathon, Alvida (the annual farewell dinner) and many more initiatives to bridge the gap between IIT Kharagpur and its esteemed alumni community.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 14-09-2017 at 06:43PM
Spring Fest

H̶a̶p̶p̶y̶ ̶H̶i̶n̶d̶i̶ ̶D̶i̶w̶a̶s̶

हिंदी दिवस की शुभकामनाएं

#हिंदी_दिवस #वसंत_उत्सव_2018

  • View the post
  • Posted on 14-09-2017 at 06:23PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

"निज भाषा उन्नति अहै ,सब उन्नति को मूल।
बिन निज भाषा ज्ञान के ,मिटै न हिय को शूल ।।"
-भारतेन्दु हरिश्चंद्र
पाश्चात्य सभ्यता को अपनाने का मतलब अपनी सभ्यता को भूलना नहीं होता। हिंदी हमारी अपनी भाषा है और इसकी उन्नति हमारे समाज और हमारी संस्कृति की उन्नति का परिचायक है।
आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से हिंदी दिवस की शुभकामनाएं!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 14-09-2017 at 05:05PM

Branding And Relations Cell

IIT Kharagpur students have bagged myriads of PPO’s from worldwide renowned companies that include names like Goldman Sach’s, Qualcomm, Texas. It is the first time that the institute has received such an overwhelming response of around 200 international companies offering internships to its students. Students of KGP opting for Foreign Training programmes during summer recess has seemed to catalyse such a response. Their hard work and dedication have been recognized and appreciated by international companies. They are pleased to come to KGP and get hold of these dedicated, sincere souls. Do give a read of the link below to know the entire scenario of these PPO’s.

http://www.financialexpre...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 14-09-2017 at 10:00AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Professor Amiya Mohanty, Professor at the Department of Mechanical Engineering, IIT Kharagpur has been elected as a fellow of the Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) with effect from 1st November 2017. He completed his Ph.D. from University of Kentucky and joined the institute in 1996. A total of 36 Indian and 5 foreign fellows have been elected this year. Presently INAE has 794 Indian and 74 foreign fellows.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates him!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 13-09-2017 at 10:08PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Just a day after we were left pondering over the decline of the Graduate Employability Ranking of IIT Kharagpur, the institute has declared in a press release that there have been more than 200 pre-placement offers from multinational companies to its students. The likes of Goldman Sachs, Samsung, Qualcomm, Texas Instruments, Adobe Systems and Wipro have offered more than 10 PPOs each. "This is an encouraging sign for us that companies recognize our students' hard work and motivation during the internship," said Prof. Debasis Deb, Professor in-charge of the Career Development Centre at IIT Kharagpur. The students have indeed boosted the reputation of the institute among the employers.
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the students and wishes all final year students all the best for the placements.
Source: http://www.business-stand...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 13-09-2017 at 09:45PM

Alumni Cell

We at Students' Alumni Cell feel proud in launching our latest initiative of 'Alumni career Assistance Program (ACAP)'. This program directly aims at assisting the students sitting for placements by allotting them an alumnus placed 1-2 years back at the company that they're aiming at for placements. The allotted alumnus will act both as a mentor and a buddy and will step by step guide the student through all the confusing placement procedures and also assist in the preparation stage.

We feel that this initiative will greatly help the students at probably one of their most crucial stages in KGP and at the same time will also mark the engagement of the alumni with their alma mater right from the start!

Both alumni and students are requested to follow the link and register with their details:
http://www.sac.iitkgp.ac....

For further queries, contact:
Utkarsh Sinha (8969169656)

  • View the post
  • Posted on 13-09-2017 at 05:50PM
Alumni Cell

We at Students' Alumni Cell feel proud in launching our latest initiative of 'Alumni career Assistance Program (ACAP)'. This program directly aims at assisting the students sitting for placements by allotting them an alumnus placed 1-2 years back at the company that they're aiming at for placements. The allotted alumnus will act both as a mentor and a buddy and will step by step guide the student through all the confusing placement procedures and also assist in the preparation stage.

We feel that this initiative will greatly help the students at probably one of their most crucial stages in KGP and at the same time will also mark the engagement of the alumni with their alma mater right from the start!

Both alumni and students are requested to follow the link and register with their details:
http://www.sac.iitkgp.ac....

  • Posted on 13-09-2017 at 12:57PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

By 2022, one-third of students across Indian Institutes of Technology (IIT) should be women and that’s the aim for the current government in its mission to empower women and rectify the gender imbalance across top science and engineering institutes across the country. Right now, women make up just about 8 % of the student population across the 23 IITs.
Department of Science and Technology is going to hold camps at the district levels to teach 50,000 senior secondary girls for IIT JEE as well as convince their parents.

Source: https://theprint.in/2017/...

  • View the post

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

हिंदी दिवस के अवसर पर राजभाषा विभाग के द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही निबंध लेखन प्रतियोगिता और अतिथि व्याख्यान में आप सभी सादर आमंत्रित हैं।
निबंध लेखन प्रतियोगिता का विषय है - 'मेक इन इंडिया' दौर के विकासशील भारत में हिंदी का स्वरुप एवं भविष्य।
साथ ही आईआईटी खड़गपुर के भूतपूर्व छात्र एवं प्रसिद्ध जल वैज्ञानिक डॉ. दिनेश कुमार मिश्र [1968/बीटेक/सिविल] से मिलने और विचारों के आदान-प्रदान का भी अवसर प्राप्त होगा। वे अतिथि व्याख्यान में भारत की नदियों के भाषिक, सांस्कृतिक एवं वैज्ञानिक महत्व पर अपने बहुमूल्य विचार प्रस्तुत करेंगे।
दिनांक: 14 सितम्बर 2017
समय: 9:00 बजे पूर्वाह्न
स्थान: एस एन बोस ऑडिटोरियम

  • View the post
  • Posted on 12-09-2017 at 09:07PM
International Relations Cell

Aerial Robotics Kharagpur (ARK) participated in its second International Aerial Robotics Competition (IARC), in Beijing.The International Aerial Robotics Competition is the longest running collegiate aerial robotics challenge in the world. This time, team ARK performed remarkably better, grabbing the "Most Innovative Design Award" for their hexacopter named 'Falcon'.

To know more about the competition and ARK's performance read our blog-

http://wp.me/p7L0xP-6C

  • View the post

Technology Students Gymkhana

सभी से निवेदन है कि कार्यक्रम में अवश्य पधारें।

  • View the post
  • Posted on 12-09-2017 at 12:08AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.

As the first initiative in the student welfare portfolio, the Technology Students' Gymkhana in association with Counselling Center, IIT Kharagpur organised a 2 day workshop on Gatekeepers training which helped students gain knowledge about detection of people with problems and how they should interact with them. The event saw a participation of around 65 students representing various halls of residences and Student Welfare Group, IIT Kharagpur. The event ended with paying condolences to the colleagues we lost last year and Prof.Somesh Kumar interacted with the students and discussed about the vision to work together for a better KGP.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 11-09-2017 at 11:51PM
Technology Students Gymkhana

As the first initiative in the student welfare portfolio, the Technology Students' Gymkhana in association with Counselling Center, IIT Kharagpur organised a 2 day workshop on Gatekeepers training which helped students gain knowledge about detection of people with problems and how they should interact with them. Branding And Relations Cell

IIT Kharagpur in its mission to provide alternate and better energy sources for India for a sustainable future has come up with a microbial fuel cell that can be made using commonly accessible components. The 'bio-cell' can be made using very simple and economical materials like filter paper, eyeliner, organic fuel and some bacteria.

https://researchmatters.i...

SILVER- Abhrajit Saha (LBS) - 39 points.
BRONZE- Suraj K (RK), Shashwat Mondal (RK), Shreya Santra (SN), Mohit Singh (LLR) - 38.5 points.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the participants for their amazing performances.

Technology Students Gymkhana

Today is World Suicide Prevention Day and we would like to thank Mr. Sheetal Sagar,IIT Kharagpur alumnus(Batch of 2014) who came today to address the students on "Normalizing Mental Health".

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 09:15PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The 65th Inter Hall Athletics came to a splendid end with miraculous performances by the athletes and saw a smooth conduction throughout all three days. The closing ceremony started with medal distributions, followed by the announcement of Best Athletes and final Hall standings. And it ended with National Anthem.
The event saw the esteemed presence of dignitaries like Dean (UGS), Dean of Students' Affairs and President (TSG) who gave away the medals to athletes and lifted their spirits.
Also, some of the scenes on the ground were testimony of the sportsman spirit that we KGPians have. While dignitaries were awarding Abin, Sairam, Gaurav and many more athletes the medals, each and every member of all the hall teams gave them standing ovation in unison! It definitely speaks volumes about the sportsman spirit that we have developed over the years, given some unfortunate events that happened last semester.
We would like to thank each and every stakeholder who was involved in the smooth conduction of the meet including General Secretaries, Professor In-Charge, ground staffs, staff members from District Council of School Sports and Games (Midnapur) and all others.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 09:15PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The 65th Inter Hall Athletics came to a splendid end with miraculous performances by the athletes and saw a smooth conduction throughout all three days. The closing ceremony started with medal distributions, followed by the announcement of Best Athletes and final Hall standings. And it ended with National Anthem.
The event saw the esteemed presence of dignitaries like Dean (UGS), Dean of Students' Affairs and President (TSG) who gave away the medals to athletes and lifted their spirits.
Also, some of the scenes on the ground were testimony of the sportsman spirit that we KGPians have. While dignitaries were awarding Abin, Sairam, Gaurav and many more athletes the medals, each and every member of all the hall teams gave them standing ovation in unison! It definitely speaks volumes about the sportsman spirit that we have developed over the years, given some unfortunate events that happened last semester.
We would like to thank each and every stakeholder who was involved in the smooth conduction of the meet including General Secretaries, Professor In-Charge, ground staffs, staff members from District Council of School Sports and Games (Midnapur) and all others.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The 65th Inter Hall Athletics came to a splendid end with miraculous performances by the athletes and saw a smooth conduction throughout all three days. The closing ceremony started with medal distributions, followed by the announcement of Best Athletes and final Hall standings. And it ended with National Anthem.
The event saw the esteemed presence of dignitaries like Dean (UGS), Dean of Students' Affairs and President (TSG) who gave away the medals to athletes and lifted their spirits.

The Scholar's Avenue

Open IIT 2017 | Social and Cultural | Postering

The Open IIT Postering event was held today at S-302 from 2 PM to 5 PM.

The participants were offered three theme choices:
1. The Power of Positivity
2. Being Beautiful
3. Essence of Peace

The event witnessed a modest turnout and all the participants put their best effort in painting their thoughts and ideas on paper.

The final standings are as follows:
1. Bandana Badu [SN/IG Hall] (marks: 90/100)
2. Chaitanya Shinde [RK Hall] (marks:84/100)
3. Amlan Kumar [Nehru Hall] (marks:80/100) &
Bramha Deen [JCB Hall] (marks:80/100)

TSA congratulates all the winners!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 08:53PM
The Scholar's Avenue

Open IIT 2017 | Social and Cultural | Postering

The Open IIT Postering event was held today at S-302 from 2 PM to 5 PM.

The participants were offered three theme choices:
1. The Power of Positivity
2. Being Beautiful
3. Essence of Peace

The event witnessed a modest turnout and all the participants put their best effort in painting their thoughts and ideas on paper.

The final standings are as follows:
1. Bandana Badu [SN/IG Hall] (marks: 90/100)
2. Chaitanya Shinde [RK Hall] (marks:84/100)
3. Amlan Kumar [Nehru Hall] (marks:80/100) &
Bramha Deen [JCB Hall] (marks:80/100)

TSA congratulates all the winners!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 08:12PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Open IIT 2017-18 || Postering
The Open IIT Postering Competition saw an active participation from the students. Participants were provided three topics, 'The​ ​Power​ ​of ​Positivity', 'Being Beautiful', 'Essence of Peace', out of which they had to choose any one. The results are as follows:-

First - Bandana Badu (SN/IG)- 90/100
Second - Chaitanya Shinde (RK)- 84/100
Third - Amlan Kumar Sahu (Nehru) and Brahma Deen (JCB)- 80/100

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners!

  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 08:12PM

The Scholar's Avenue

Sports and Games GC 2017 | Inter Hall Athletics

The Inter Hall Athletics meet ended this evening at the Gnan Ghosh Stadium after huge participation!

The interhall records for long jump and the Inter IIT record for discuss throw events were broken this time!

The Hall Standings for the GC after the meet are as follows:

Men's Senior
1. MS (83 Points)
2. Azad (35 Points)
3. LBS (30 Points)
4. RP (24 Points)

Men's Junior
1. RK (72 Points)
2. MS (39 Points)
3. Patel (18 Points)
4. VS (17 Points)

Women's Senior
1. SN/IG
2. MT(Joint)
2. Gokhale (Joint)
4. SAM

Women's Junior
1. SN/IG (49 Points)
2. MT(32 Points)

The Scholars' Avenue heartily congratulates the winners.

And The Inter IIT record for discuss throw events were broken this time!

Technology Literary Society

On the occasion of World Suicide Prevention Day 2017, TLS presents to you all a beautiful hybrid composition by Yash Shukla

----
There will be days,
When you’ll feel, you possess nothing.
Deprived of love, trust, faith, hope
And all the feelings which constitute everything.
Those lonely times when
you’ll hate yourself the most,
mind will take absurd decisions
no matter how much it’ll cost.

ख्यालों के शहर में ख्वाबों की कब्र होगी,
खुशियों के रास्तों पर ग़म की गश्त होगी,
खामोश चीखों की पुरज़ोर गूंज होगी,
न जाने फिर कब लफ़्ज़ों में आवाज़ होगी।
मन शायद तुमसे बस यही सवाल पूछेगा,
क्या कभी इस रात की सुबह होगी।

But hold on, hold on for a moment.
Do you really want to die
Or again are these the external hopes
which are making your life a lie.
Because you think once you’re gone
they’ll talk fondly of you.
They’ll conclude whether it was
academic pressure or recession that killed you
or it was the black hole of competition
which finally consumed you.

पर,
उन कविताओं का क्या होगा जो तुमने लिखीं थी,
कैनवास की उस पेंटिंग का क्या होगा जो तुमने बुनी थी,
बचपन के सपनों की उस डोर का क्या होगा
जो तुम्हारी नींद से जुडी थीं,
साँसों की वो हवा भी बेकार हो जाएगी जो तुम्हारे हिस्से में लिखी थी।
वो कौन से ऐसी बात है जो जता देगी
कि तुम्हारी ज़िन्दगी जीने के लिए काबिल न थी।

Every time, this beast kills someone
in every 40th second,
imagine you’re not the only one, many are the
victims of this trend.
So when those days will make you weak,
just go to your friend and speak.

क्योंकि क्या पता ज़िन्दगी का यह मोड़
तुम्हे मौत से कुछ दिन बाद मिलवाये,
वो जो मकसद है जिसके लिए तुम आये हो
इस जहाँ में,
यह तुमको उसके और करीब ले जाए।

----
https://tlsiitkgp.org/sui...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 07:44PM
Technology Literary Society

On the occasion of World Suicide Prevention Day 2017, TLS presents to you all a beautiful hybrid composition by Yash Shukla

----
There will be days,
When you’ll feel, you possess nothing.
Deprived of love, trust, faith, hope
And all the feelings which constitute everything.
Those lonely times when
you’ll hate yourself the most,
mind will take absurd decisions
no matter how much it’ll cost.

ख्यालों के शहर में ख्वाबों की कब्र होगी,
खुशियों के रास्तों पर ग़म की गश्त होगी,
खामोश चीखों की पुरज़ोर गूंज होगी,
न जाने फिर कब लफ़्ज़ों में आवाज़ होगी।
मन शायद तुमसे बस यही सवाल पूछेगा,
क्या कभी इस रात की सुबह होगी।

But hold on, hold on for a moment.
Do you really want to die
Or again are these the external hopes
which are making your life a lie.
Because you think once you’re gone
they’ll talk fondly of you.
They’ll conclude whether it was
academic pressure or recession that killed you
or it was the black hole of competition
which finally consumed you.

पर,
उन कविताओं का क्या होगा जो तुमने लिखीं थी,
कैनवास की उस पेंटिंग का क्या होगा जो तुमने बुनी थी,
बचपन के सपनों की उस डोर का क्या होगा
जो तुम्हारी नींद से जुडी थीं,
साँसों की वो हवा भी बेकार हो जाएगी जो तुम्हारे हिस्से में लिखी थी।
वो कौन से ऐसी बात है जो जता देगी
कि तुम्हारी ज़िन्दगी जीने के लिए काबिल न थी।

Every time, this beast kills someone
in every 40th second,
imagine you’re not the only one, many are the
victims of this trend.
So when those days will make you weak,
just go to your friend and speak.

क्योंकि क्या पता ज़िन्दगी का यह मोड़
तुम्हे मौत से कुछ दिन बाद मिलवाये,
वो जो मकसद है जिसके लिए तुम आये हो
इस जहाँ में,
यह तुमको उसके और करीब ले जाए।

----

https://medium.com/@shukl...

  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 06:52PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

|| Best Athletes ||
Today was the 3rd and final day of 65th Inter-Hall Athletics Meet. The day concluded on a high with some really inspirational performances. Throughout the day, the athletes participated with never-ending zeal. Though all of them put their hearts out, few stood above all and were awarded as the best athletes in their respective categories. They are as follows:-

Men's Senior- Abin Devassia
Women's Senior- Dimple Kapadia
Men's Junior- Eslavath Jaga Deesh
Women's Junior- Hima Swetha

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates all of them!

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

|| Final Hall Standings ||
The 65th Inter Hall Athletics Meet ended today after experiencing huge participation from the students. The Jnan Ghosh Stadium wore a festive look for three days and the students from all the halls reached there to cheer for the athletes.
Hall Standings are as follows:

Men's Senior
1. MS (83 Points)
2. Azad (35 Points)
3. LBS (30 Points)
4. RP (24 Points)

Women's Senior*
1. SN/IG
2. MT(Joint)
2. Gokhale (Joint)
4. SAM

Men's Junior
1. RK (72 Points)
2. MS (39 Points)
3. Patel (18 Points)
4. VS (17 Points)

Women's Junior*
1. SN/IG (49 Points)
2. MT(32 Points)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates the winners.

Day 3

The day witnessed a surge in footfall of audience. Sunday progressed fine with the crowd glorifying the victors with their cheers. The results are as follows.

1. Manish Singh Rana (MMM)
2. Aniruddha Patel (LLR)
3. Ram Pal Barjathi (RP)
4. Soumya Laddha (VSR)

1. Pradeep Jat (RK)
2. Narpat Ram (RK)
3. Praveen Kumar Singh (MS)
4. Sourabh (Azad)

Shot Put
1. Anand (LLR)
2. Ayush Kumar (Nehru)
3. Sanskar Nahadia (Azad)
4. Abhishek Koushal (HJB)

Manish Singh Rana ( winner of 5000m Sprint) : "I worked hard to build my stamina. A lot of credit goes to my coach. This was the first time I participated and getting a gold in the first attempt makes this even more special."

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners.

from pen of a KGPian and author of Target Locked and Henpecked

&& NMD - HIDE & SEEK &&
(a detective novel - in the category of actions and thriller)

This weekend, reading for free with Kindle Book and Kindle Unlimited!

never missing the opportunity,
SAVE $ 3.00 -- the offer is available for limited time only!
So, HURRY and get your copy on your device, exclusively from Amazon.
also, don't forget to write a review....
______________________

In recent time, we have not gone through a thriller, full of heroic adventures. Nor we locate a secret agent’s story in shelf that is intriguing and nail-biting! The shortage is made up with Karan's NMD - HIDE & SEEK....

After the conversation on phone is over, Jack looks at his ladies expecting them to refrain now, and he says, ‘Well, girls, are you hopped up about making an exit from a running train…?’

Replying together, the two ladies say, ‘Yeah…!’ ‘Of course!’

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 08:00AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

With the declaration of 65th Interhall Athletics Meet open, a magnanimous participation was witnessed in all the events. The stadium experienced decent turnout of the crowd cheering for their Halls of Residence. Yesterday, it all started with Junior Men & Women events in 800 meters. SN Hall of Residence performed exceptionally well by bagging a total of 3 medals in Junior Women category. MS Hall, the defending champions of GC Athletics Men, left everyone speechless by securing a total of 5 medals, all the three in the senior category and gold & silver in the junior category. Manish Singh Rana (MMM Hall) managed to win the gold for his hall of residence in both 800 m and 1500 m. Lokesh Reddi and Gaurav Shenoy were among the few names who secured medals in every event they participated and left no stone unturned to contribute towards the sport. Among girls, Bharti Kushal Sharma, Dimple Kapadia, and Hima Swetha showed outstanding performances. In Men JR category, Sagar Kongari, Eslavatha Jaga Deesh, and Sumit Gaurav have shown exceptional performances by winning more than one medal for their respective halls.

MS Hall continues its legacy in GC Athletics by scoring a sum of 53 points on Day 1 and Day 2. According to the current tally of points, the competition for the second position is too fierce with the difference of just one point between RP (14 Points) and LBS (13 Points). In GC Athletics women’s category, SN Hall of Residence is leading others with 30 points. Junior events, however, with the contribution of no points in General Championship, were also quite successful with the active participation in Men’s category.

With the showcase of such fine performances, we expect the events will exhibit the same enthusiasm and sportsmanship and Day 3 will witness wonders. Here are the comprehensive results of events till now.

800 M MEN
1. Manish Singh Rana (MMM)
2. Sainath Reddy (RP)
3. Neeraj Kumar (Azad)
4. Pankaj Kulriya (RP)

800 M MEN JR
1. Elsavath Jaga Deesh (VS)
2. Aditya Kadiyan (RK)
3. Bikash Kumar Sahoo (RK)
4. Saurabh Sihag (Azad)

800 M WOMEN
1. Bharti Kaushal Sharma (SN)
2. Pushpa Dhruv (SAM)

800 M WOMEN JR
1. Hima Swetha (SN)
2. Pooja Arakh (SN)
3. Jenet Narzary (MT)

LONG JUMP WOMEN
1. Dimple kapadia (SN)
2. Papi Bhanja (SAM)

LONG JUMP WOMEN JR
1. Rupali Kumari (SN)
2. Arpita Sahoo (MT)

TRIPLE JUMP MEN
1. Lokesh Reddi (MS) | 12.83m
2. Gaurav Shenoy (MS) | 12.34m
3. Mukund Chavan (MS) | 11.32m
4. Sulthan SF (Patel) | 10.77m

TRIPLE JUMP MEN JR
1. Sagar Kongari (MS) | 11.20m
2. Sumit Gaurav (MS) | 11.20m
3. Swapnil Bhowmik (RP) | 10.85m
4. Prithviraj Hial (Patel) | 10.68m

1500 M MEN
1. Manish Singh Rana (MMM)
2. Aniruddha Patel (LLR)
3. Rampal Barjati (RP)
4. Pankaj Kulriya (RP)

1500 M MEN JR
1. Vikash Meena (Azad)
2. Narpat Ram Kalwaniyan (RK)
3. Ayush Raj (Azad)
4. M. Koushik Raj (LBS)

400 M MEN
1. Gaurav Shenoy (MS)
2. Sairam Alla (Azad)
3. Sainath Reddy (RP)
4. Bhuvan Meravi (Nehru)

4X400 M RELAY MEN
1. MS Hall: Lokesh Reddi, Gaurav Shenoy, Anand Raj, Mukund Chavan
2. LBS Hall: Vishal Rathor, Chetan Singh Rana, Abhinav Mishra, Shivam Singh
3. Azad Hall: Arvind Allu, Akhil Viru, Neeraj Kumar, Sairam Alla
4. RP Hall: Utsav Mazumder, Sainath Reddy, Surendra Puri, Pankaj Kulriya

HIGH JUMP MEN
1. Sumit Gaurav (MS)
2. Sanath Kailash (Nehru)
3. Vaishnav Katihar (RP)
4. Lav Rathore (Patel)

400 M MEN JR
1. Aditya Kadiyan (RK)

  • View the post
  • Posted on 10-09-2017 at 08:00AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

With the declaration of 65th Interhall Athletics Meet open, a magnanimous participation was witnessed in all the events. The stadium experienced decent turnout of the crowd cheering for their Halls of Residence. Yesterday, it all started with Junior Men & Women events in 800 meters. SN Hall of Residence performed exceptionally well by bagging a total of 3 medals in Junior Women category. MS Hall, the defending champions of GC Athletics Men, left everyone speechless by securing a total of 5 medals, all the three in the senior category and gold & silver in the junior category. Manish Singh Rana (MMM Hall) managed to win the gold for his hall of residence in both 800 m and 1500 m. Lokesh Reddi and Gaurav Shenoy were among the few names who secured medals in every event they participated and left no stone unturned to contribute towards the sport. Among girls, Bharti Kushal Sharma, Dimple Kapadia, and Hima Swetha showed outstanding performances. In Men JR category, Sagar Kongari, Eslavatha Jaga Deesh, and Sumit Gaurav have shown exceptional performances by winning more than one medal for their respective halls.

MS Hall continues its legacy in GC Athletics by scoring a sum of 53 points on Day 1 and Day 2. According to the current tally of points, the competition for the third position is too fierce with the difference of just one point between RP (14 Points) and LBS (13 Points). In GC Athletics women’s category, SN Hall of Residence is leading others with 30 points. Junior events, however, with the contribution of no points in General Championship, were also quite successful with the active participation in Men’s category.

With the showcase of such fine performances, we expect the events will exhibit the same enthusiasm and sportsmanship and Day 3 will witness wonders. Here are the comprehensive results of events till now.

800 M MEN
1. Manish Singh Rana (MMM)
2. Sainath Reddy (RP)
3. Neeraj Kumar (Azad)
4. Pankaj Kulriya (RP)

1. Elsavath Jaga Deesh (VS)
2. Aditya Kadiyan (RK)

  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 10:32PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

September 10th is World Suicide Prevention Day and to generate awareness around emotional and mental health, 'I Will' by EpsyClinic is presenting an interactive talk on "Normalizing mental health" with an objective to remove stigma regarding mental health and to share a solution with people suffering from emotional or mental health issues.
Venue: SN Bose Auditorium
Time: 12 PM
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges the students to come forward and attend the talk purposefully bringing those friends who show signs of depression by some means or the other and do your bit to make IIT KGP a better and happier place to live in.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 09:09PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Freshers turned up in optimistic numbers for a tree plantation programme conducted in the Vikram Sarabhai Residential Complex. This plantation drive was organised under the latest phase of the induction programme activities. Students, divided into groups of four, planted different species of plants with the help of gardeners.
Dean(UGS), Prof S.K.Barai, was present throughout the two-hour programme to lift the spirits of the students.
Moreover, caps which read "The spirit of KGP" were distributed to showcase the essence of the activity.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 08:31PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Hello KGPians,
As you know and you might have observed as well that our team has been continuously putting up sincere efforts to make the results of all the events of ongoing Inter Hall Athletics Meet available for you all. We are trying to leave no stone unturned for the same. But unfortunately, most of the posts that were made today have been removed by Facebook mentioning them as 'spam'. Hence, you might not be able to see today's results which were up on our page a few hours ago. The inconvenience caused is deeply regretted. We are trying to re-post all the results. Meanwhile, if someone can provide suggestions regarding how those posts can be brought back, kindly contact us!
Stay tuned for all the updates. We will provide today's summary in a while. These hiccups are not going to dampen our journalistic spirits! We have always been dedicated to make the news reach to you all as soon as possible and we will keep doing that!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 06:51PM
Spring Fest

"Opportunities are like sunrises. If you wait too long, you miss them."

Here we present before you the registration portal for Hitch Hike, the Nationwide Prelims of Spring Fest 2018 which will be happening in all the major cities of India this October!

Scoot over to https://nwp.springfest.in... / to register your team and book your slots!

Grab this opportunity and 'Hitch Hike' your way to the Finals at Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur.

Kudos to Akash, Ankita, Atul, Neelanjan, Nilay, Nishant, Omar, Prakhar, Sandeep and Shashi for getting together our NWP Portal!

#HitchHike
#SpringFest_2018

  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 06:51PM

The Scholar's Avenue

Tree Plantation Event | Induction Program

The Institute conducted yet another event for freshers under the Induction Program. This time it was the Tree Plantation Event. A large number of trees were planted near the Vikram Sarabhai Residential Complex. Students were split into groups of four and each group was given a plant to plant. Guava, Jamrul, Chiku were a few of the types of tree saplings planted by the freshers. This event was witness to a large number of students participating with great enthusiasm. Each of the participating students received a cap at the end of the event. Also, Dean of UGS Prof. S K Barai was also spotted there greeting the students participating.

  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 05:30PM

A talk before mid semester examination.

"September 10th is World Suicide Prevention Day and to generate awareness around emotional and mental health, I Will by EpsyClinic is presenting an interactive talk on "Normalizing mental health" with an objective to remove stigma around mental health and to share a solution with people suffering from emotional or mental health issues. Entrepreneurship Cell

Entrepreneurship is not a career option, it is a dynamic lifestyle.
Entrepreneurs put a lot of effort into their startups, and receive leaps and bounds more than they invested.
Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Kharagpur brings the soul and spirit of entrepreneurship to your city, the Entrepreneurship Awareness Drive ( EAD ) 2017.
Witness great entrepreneurs of your city share their experience and knowledge, and unearth the entrepreneur in you.
Stay tuned for registrations !

Branding And Relations Cell

Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur shared their post.

The Young Innovators' Program (YIP) organized for the first time by IIT Kharagpur received a fervent response from students from all over India. YIP aims at kindling the fire of innovation in students of 8th, 9th and 10th standard. The initial round saw a pan India participation of 250 teams or 600 students and 60 of them are contesting in the second round, which is synopsis submission.The teams selected for the third round will have a chance to visit IIT Kharagpur and display their idea in presence of distinguished researchers. To know in details, give a read of the link below.

http://www.millenniumpost...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 02:02PM
Branding And Relations Cell

The Young Innovators' Program (YIP) organized for the first time by IIT Kharagpur received a fervent response from students from all over India. YIP aims at kindling the fire of innovation in students of 8th, 9th and 10th standard. The initial round saw a pan India participation of 250 teams or 600 students and 60 of them are contesting in the second round, which is synopsis submission.The teams selected for the third round will have a chance to visit IIT Kharagpur and display their idea in presence of distinguished researchers. To know in details, give a read of the link below.

The Scholar's Avenue

The standings for the men's juniors' 4×400m relay event of the Inter-Hall Athletics of the Sports and Games GC (2017-18) are as follows:

1.RK Hall
a.) Rahul Singh
b.) Aditya Kadiyan
c.) Bikash Kumar Sahoo
d.) Japunsgar Brahma

2.MS Hall
a.) Sagar Kongari
b.) Rahul Maloth

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The 65th Inter Hall Athletics Meet, the first set of events of General Championship 2017-18, has been ceremonially declared open this morning by Prof. Somesh Kumar, Dean SA.The ceremony started with the hoisting of the flag followed by the march past by the athletes of all the halls participating in the meet. The march past was led by Lokeshwara Rao Reddi carrying the IIT flag. The athletes then took oath of following the sportsman spirit which was administered by Manish Datta, GSec Sports And Games,TSG. Prof. William Kumar Mohanty, President, TSG and Prof. Somesh Kumar addressed the students and applauded the enthusiasm shown by the students to promote sports in the campus.
Stay tuned to our page for the updates.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 11:31AM

The Scholar's Avenue

Sports and Games GC (2017-18) || Inter-Hall Athletics

The 65th Inter Hall Athletics meet kick-started with great grandeur on September 9, 2017. The early morning turnout was quite modest, as the Jnan Ghosh stadium was marked by sporadic groups of people huddled together.The first event, the 1500m junior race (men's) started at 8:50 am with close to 25 participants.The standings were

1) Vikash Meena (Azad)
2) Narpat Ram Kalvanian (RK)
3) Kaushik Raj (LBS)
4) Ayush Raj (Azad)

TSA congratulates the winners. Stay tuned to our page for updates. #InterHallAthletics

  • Posted on 09-09-2017 at 10:10AM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Professor Aritra Hazra, Assistant Professor of Computer Science & Engineering Department, IIT Kharagpur has been awarded the prestigious INAE Young Engineer Award 2017. He has joined the department from August 2017 and has previously served at IIT Madras.

Indian National Academy of Engineering (INAE) was established in 1987 to promote the advancement of and excellence in the field of engineering and technology and related science and disciplines and the purpose of the INAE Young Engineer Award is to recognize outstanding achievements contributions made by Young Engineers in any branch of engineering.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur heartily congratulates our professor!

  • Posted on 08-09-2017 at 08:44PM

The Scholar's Avenue

Open-IIT 2017 | Sports | Table Tennis

The Open-IIT Table Tennis tournament was held on 27th and 28th August for men and women respectively. The Old-Gymkhana witnessed the intense and fast paced action where participants were seen putting in all their effort and showcasing their skills while adhering to the true spirit of sportsmanship.

The results for the tournament were as follows:

Men-
1st- Reetam Roy(16IE10024)
2nd- Sourish Ghosh(14MA20054)
3rd- Abhinav Gupta(17ME10001)
4th- Anmol Basant(13EX20002)

Women-
1st- Akhila Kosaraju(14AR10018)
2nd- Roshni Bhowmik(16AR10030)
3rd- Ojaswee Deewan(16AG10019)
4th- Pooja Rawat(17EX20019)

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the winners.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 08-09-2017 at 12:55AM

Branding And Relations Cell

This year India is witnessing the first of its kind a PAN India competition organized by the most dynamic IIT of India. IIT Kharagpur has launched Young Innovators’ Program(YIP) for the 8th, 9th and 10th class students. The institute wants to engage the students in analysing real life problems and find solutions for the same. YIP is an effort to produce this outcome. Schools all over India have responded positively to this competition. Around 600 registrations and synopsis submissions have been witnessed. YIP consists of 4 rounds. Presently, 60 teams are contesting in the 2nd round to secure their place in the upcoming rounds which are scheduled at IIT Kharagpur. To know in details, do give a read of the link below.

http://indiatoday.intoday...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-09-2017 at 08:11PM
Branding And Relations Cell

This year India is witnessing the first of its kind a PAN India competition organized by the most dynamic IIT of India. Yes IIT Kharagpur has launched Young Innovators’ Program(YIP) for the 8th, 9th and 10th class students. The institute wants to engage the students in analysing real life problems and find solutions for the same. YIP is an effort to produce this outcome. Schools all over India have responded positively to this competition. Around 600 registrations and synopsis submissions have been witnessed. YIP consists of 4 rounds. Presently, 60 teams are contesting in the 2nd round to secure their place in the upcoming rounds which are scheduled at IIT Kharagpur. To know in details, do give a read of the link below.

http://indiatoday.intoday...

  • Posted on 07-09-2017 at 07:09PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

GC 2017-18 || Sports and Games || 65th Inter Hall Athletics Meet || Jnan Ghosh Stadium
Schedule for DAY 1, 2 and 3 has been released. Events will commence on the evening of 8th September. The opening ceremony would take place on 9th September.

PS: JR Championship is supposed to be organised for 1st and 2nd year students similar to the last year, but it entirely depends on the participation of students. However, the points obtained through JR Championship would not be included in the final standings of the halls.
We urge the first and second year students to make JR Championship successful with their active participation.
For further updates, stay tuned to Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-09-2017 at 05:30PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Students of IIT Kharagpur to organize a PAN India Competition called “Young Innovators' Program (YIP)” on technology ideation for young innovators from school.
The competition would be conducted by Branding and Relations Cell (BARC), IIT Kharagpur for students belonging to 8th to 10th standard. It would cover major aspects such as Energy, Agriculture, Food, Environment, Hardware Modelling and Biotechnology. Teams from across various locations in India would be competing. It is supposed to harness the creativity of hundreds of bright young minds to apply their scientific knowledge to real life problems and come up with digital yet sustainable innovative solutions.The students would get a chance to explore the scientific environment within and an opportunity to present their projects in front of distinguished researchers. The program comprises of three rounds, the second round has already been started and the submissions will be accepted until 10th September. The final round is scheduled to be held at IIT Kharagpur, this year on 28th and 29th October.
For more information, visit http://www.barc.iitkgp.ac...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-09-2017 at 01:40PM
Technology Students Gymkhana

Greetings from Teach For India!

Did you know?
In India, 4% of all children never start school
52% of 5th Standard students in a low income government school cannot read a 2nd standard textbook
48% of children drop out of school by 5th Standard
76% of students do not complete school and do not make it to college
​How can I sign up for the information session?
The 2018 Fellowship Application is now live and we are hoping to recruit leaders from your college for a 2 year, full time paid commitment.

We are going to be presenting at IIT Kharagpur on 7th Sept 2017 from 6:30 pm onwards at v1 (Vikramshila)

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-09-2017 at 11:55AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Just after a slip in the QS and THE world rankings, the IITs received a huge setback when the Finance Ministry turned down the proposal of MHRD to allocate Rs 8,700 crores to enhance their global standings. The Finance Ministry was of the opinion that the premiere institutes should first address “fundamental issues” such as the autonomy to fix fees, raising resources from corporate houses and alumni members, and strengthening existing schemes.
Under Project Vishwajeet, which was cleared last year by the IIT council, the top seven IITs were supposed to use the funds (Rs 1,250 crores each over a five-year period) to upgrade their infrastructure, hire foreign faculty members, tie up with international institutions and adopt a host of other measures for improving their QS and Times global institution rankings. As no Indian Institute could make it into top 200, it certainly proved that things were not going right and there were points to ponder over!
In its note, the finance ministry also recommended that the human resource development ministry should ask IITs to construct world-class laboratories through existing grants or the recently launched Institute of Eminence scheme. Under the Institute of Eminence scheme, 10 select government institutes will be given approximately Rs 1,000 crores. "The finance ministry has suggested that the IITs should compete for that scheme instead of expecting funds through the Vishwajeet project,” an official said.
Source: http://www.hindustantimes...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-09-2017 at 11:01AM
Director IIT Kharagpur

http://indianexpress.com/...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 06-09-2017 at 10:19PM
The Scholar's Avenue

The Open IIT Hindi Elocution event was held today at F-127 (Maggu Room) from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. With speeches ranging from social and political satires to mythological tales to transgender rights, the enthusiastic participation of 44 students filled the room with a spectrum of emotions over the course of the event.

The standings of the event are as follows:

Gold: Vivek Mallik (RK) | 25/25
Silver: Mohd Issa (Patel) and Yash Shukla (Nehru) | 24.5/25
Bronze: Aditya Ranjan (Azad) and Abha Kumari (SN) | 22.5/25

Professor Amit Upadhyay, the judge for the event, applauded the efforts of the participants and mentioned that we are fortunate that we enjoy such freedom of speech in our country that we can talk freely even about the most sensitive topics.

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates all the winners and the participants for their amazing performances.

ProDex

We are proud to announce that 2 teams of Prodex, majorly comprising of 1st year students bagged the 2nd and 4th positions at Open IIT Product Design Competition held on 3rd September, 2017. Our heartiest congratulations to all the participants.

Our silver winning product Evapo-reefer was designed for the efficient transportation of fruits and vegetables over long distances. The product was based on the concept of evaporative cooling and could help in solving food wastage due to ineffective food storage and transportation facilities.
#Silver
#Open_IIT
#Prodex

  • View the post
  • Posted on 06-09-2017 at 01:34PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The Times Higher Education (THE) rankings 2018 of the world’s top 1,000 universities in 77 countries was published yesterday and didn't pan out well for Indian institutions. Most of the Indian Institutes dropped down the ranking list as compared to previous year. Indian Institute of Science (IISc) slipped from the 201-250 band to 251-300. IIT Delhi, Kanpur and Madras came down to the 501–600 band from last year’s 401-500 rankings. IIT Kharagpur remained in 501-600 band as was the case last year.

Times Higher Education attributed this dismal showing to “drops in research influence score and research income,” and said most of the institutes “performed poorly on the internationalisation pillar.” The number of international students coming into India was limited. International scholars also were not being hired for long-term faculty positions.

“China, Hong Kong and Singapore all invest very heavily in their university systems. This year, almost all universities in the three regions improved their standing in the ranking, signalling that their commitment to investment has bolstered results year-on-year,” Phil Baty, editorial director, Global Rankings, THE, said. He said that things were likely to improve because of the “really positive news in that India’s overall research income and research quality has risen this year, and the country’s world class university plan shows that it recognises the importance of investing in higher education.”

Here. we present to you a comparison of QS Rankings and THE Rankings of 2017 as well as 2018.
Source: http://www.livemint.com/E...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 06-09-2017 at 01:12PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Recently, the four co-founders of "Make The World Wonderful" i.e., Meghana Dabbara, Saumya Katuri, Khyathi Chodagiri and Pranita Garimella visited IIT Kharagpur and we were blessed to have such beautiful people in our campus. Their visit was followed by a guest lecture by them at Kalidas auditorium. Meanwhile, we got the privilege to talk to them and get to know their mind. They descriptively talked about their experience in KGP, their idea, journey, obstacles, and expectations.
Make the World Wonderful is an NGO, a civil society organization that aims to build harmony in society. They primarily work with children and youth, because they believe that when equipped with proper values and skills, youngers have the power to bring about positive social change.
At the core, they have a dedicated team of four young 18-year old girls, working towards fulfilling their vision of the harmonious world. Make The World Wonderful is a pilot project of iB Hubs, a Pan-India Startup Hub. With the constant support and guidance, they have formed multiple support teams, such as the Society Body, Technical Support Team, Administrative support team and so on. To know more, you can visit: http://maketheworldwonder... /

(Do pardon us for a slight lag in voice in the latter part of the video)

  • Posted on 05-09-2017 at 07:08PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

How would you feel when someone takes an initiative to make you feel happy? And what if that is taken by none other than the government? Yes, you read it right! The government is going to take an initiative to make people feel happy. The state government has come to terms with IIT Kharagpur's Rekhi Centre of Excellence for Science of Happiness for the development of Happiness Index. After taking few steps like fixing parameters of happiness index with surveys, which is to be conducted by IIT KGP in assistance with state government, the latter will start this initiative. Manohar Dubey, Chief Executive Officer of Rajya Anand Sansthan, said that the survey will start within a month. Under this initiative in Madhya Pradesh, over 115 Anand Clubs have been opened with the objective being to ensure "happiness in lives of the common man".
Source: http://timesofindia.india...

Kshitij

A teacher takes a hand, opens a mind and touches a heart.
Teachers aren't restricted to the people imparting education in the classrooms. There are a lot of things around us that have influenced our outlook, and helped us grow as a person.
This Teacher's Day, Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur urges everyone to reflect on their parents, friends, acquaintances or even the thoughts and experiences, all of whom have shaped their formative years, and have played the role of a teacher in ways more than one.
Wish you all a very happy Teacher's Day.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

"गुरू कुम्हार शिष कुंभ है, गढि़ गढि़ काढ़ै खोट।
अन्तर हाथ सहार दै, बाहर बाहै चोट।।"
Famous Hindi Poet Kabirdas says, "A teacher is actually a potter who very cautiously turns a lump of soil into a beautiful pot. His outer behaviour may be a little bit tough in order to teach us with discipline, but his inner love for his students is sumptuous. Just like a potter hits the under-construction pot from outside, but one hand is always inside it to support it."
हमें कच्ची मिटटी की ढेर से पक्का घड़ा बनाने की कवायद करने वाले कुम्भकार को हमारा शत शत नमन!
Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the members of teaching Community a Happy Teacher's Day.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-09-2017 at 01:17PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

"गुरू कुम्हार शिष कुंभ है, गढि़ गढि़ काढ़ै खोट।
अन्तर हाथ सहार दै, बाहर बाहै चोट।।"
Famous Hindi Poet Kabirdas says, "A teacher is actually a potter who very cautiously turns a lump of soil into a beautiful pot. His outer behaviour may be a little bit tough in order to teach us with discipline, but his inner love for his students is sumptuous. Just like a potter hits the under-construction pot from outside, but one hand is always inside it to support it."
हमें कच्ची मिटटी की ढेर से पक्का घड़ा बनाने की कवायद करने वाले कुम्भकार को हमारा शत शत नमन! Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the members of teaching Community a Happy Teacher's Day.

The Scholar's Avenue

गुरुर्ब्रह्मा गुरुर्विष्णुर्गुरुर्देवो महेश्वरः ।
गुरुरेव परं ब्रह्म तस्मै श्रीगुरवे नमः ॥
Teachers not only teach us, but also mould us into what we will become and show us what we can do if we put our minds to it. A good teacher can inspire us to achieve our dreams and a bad one can scar us for life; a testament to the power they have over us.
On the occasion of Dr. Sarvapalli Radhakrishnan's 129th Birthday, we at The Scholars' Avenue would like to wish all the professors of IIT Kharagpur and all the teachers of India a very Happy Teacher's Day!

P.S: A senior of this commenter once said that just greetings won't do. Let's pledge to value the teachers here by not dropping classes after two weeks in the semester and then complaining. We agree that it would be a pretty nice thing to do. After all, for all the 8 AM and 5 PM classes we haven't gone to, they have been present regardless. :')

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-09-2017 at 09:55AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In what seemed to many a not-so-anticipated as well as surprisingly pleasant gesture, the campus was abuzz with the talks of Zakir Khan being in the campus doing the rounds yesterday! Slowly and steadily, the news broke out and KGPians were all excited to get a glimpse of the rising star of Indian Comedy i.e., Zakir Khan, popularly known as "Sakht Launda" whose heart never melts, no matter what!

In a unique and first of its own kind of initiative, Vice President (Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur) i.e., Mayank Srivastava under the tutelage of TSG had contacted Zakir Khan requesting him to pay a visit to our campus. And he accepted it gleefully. There have been incidents of many celebrities visiting the campus but this one was something that KGP has never witnessed before! You come out of your room and take a stroll towards the entrance gate only to find Zakir Khan in front of you! You rub your eyes in disbelief but finally, you realize that it's reality! Needless to say, this has been an epic experience for many.

He visited Nehru Hall of Residence and interacted with students. A lot of funny moments and light conversations followed. Students were visibly excited and pleased to the core. Zakir didn't let the moment slip and tried his hands on bat-ball making it a "moment-hai-bhai-moment-hai" moment! There were plans to visit LLR hall as well but unfortunately, he wasn't able to.
Though he was here for a short period of time, he left behind smiles on hundreds of faces and that's what was the motive behind this initiative. In last one year, our campus has seen some unfortunate events happening and this was the perfect plan to boost the dampening spirit of the people.

We would like to thank all the stakeholders who were involved in this, especially VP, TSG who put all their efforts to execute this idea. We, on the behalf of entire campus, would also like to thank Zakir Khan from the core of our hearts for taking out some time of his busy schedule and making this campus livelier with his presence.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-09-2017 at 06:00AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-09-2017 at 11:28PM
The Scholar's Avenue

Zakir's Surprise Visit to the Campus!
-------------------------------------------------------------
In an unprecedented move among the recent times, our beautiful campus was blessed today with what one may call a "Happiness Visit" (term coined courtesy of a fellow KGPian). Our institute has always been the unprecedented one - even during birth and even now. But a slight tumor has started to grow, something we have recognised as a universal sin plaguing the entirety of this generation and now it's caught us in its whimsical hands. Over the past few months, our campus had the most misfortune to witness the demise of a fraction of our student community, tiny in number but gigantic in worth. It's no easy feat to recuperate from such mental fractures, but all it takes is just a little push, in the right direction, to build bridges to paradise. This is exactly what we've set in motion, if we as eyes of the campus, read right today's move.

In a secretive partnership, our VP - Mayank Srivastava along with TSG had talks with Zakir Khan, the rising face of comedy in the country, and asked him to pay a surprise visit to KGP, and Zakir accepted with much humility. He did visit before, but never like this. What we read is an initiative to make people experience the feeling of unbridled happiness, happiness that is sometimes born out of surprise, or of not knowing something. We can sure as hell imagine everyone going frantically through their Facebook Timelines not really sure whether the video of Zakir sitting there, in Nehru, in between a circle of enthused students, chatting on ignoring all the cameras about him, is true or just an elaborate prank. Incidentally Zakir is shooting a series of videos which have a similar morbid theme covered, whilst with big scoops of humanity poured into them. All you guys lucky enough to have firsthand experienced that joy, you might want to stay glued to Zakir Khan on social network sites.

It's a no brainer to connect the dots now. This moment should be remembered as one which should reinforce our firm belief in our administration, and more importantly, life again, and most importantly push us towards the end of the dark tunnel that we've gotten stuck in.

Zakir will leave by a flight tonight, pertinently unaware of the hidden blessing in what he had done, and probably and promptly laying down the road to more such wonderful surprises.

We really applaud the thinking and effort that went behind such an endeavor, mainly the VP, who seized the right moment by its throbbing vein. We would very much like to see more such meaningful and brilliant moves in the future.

"A small push in the right direction can build bridges"

#Enroute_to_being_more_Sakt

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-09-2017 at 11:28PM
The Scholar's Avenue

In an unprecedented move in the history of IIT Kharagpur, our beautiful campus was blessed with today what one may call a "Happiness Visit" (term coined courtesy of a fellow KGPian). Our institute has always been the unprecedented one - even during birth and even now. But a slight tumor has started to grow, something we have recognised as a universal sin plaguing the entirety of this generation and now it's caught us in its whimsical hands. Over the past few months, our campus had the most misfortune to witness the demise of a fraction of our student community, tiny in number but gigantic in worth. It's no easy feat to recuperate from such mental fractures, but all it takes is just a little push, in the right direction, to build bridges to paradise. This is exactly what we've set in motion, if we as eyes of the campus, read right today's move.

In a secretive partnership, our VP - Mayank Srivastava along with TSG had talks with Zakir Khan, the rising face of comedy in the country, and asked him to pay a surprise visit to KGP, and Zakir accepted with much humility. What we read is an initiative to make people experience the feeling of unbridled happiness, happiness that is sometimes born out of surprise, or of not knowing something. We can sure as hell imagine everyone going frantically through their Facebook Timelines not really sure whether the video of Zakir sitting there in between a circle of enthused students, chatting on ignoring all the cameras about him, is true or just an elaborate prank. Incidentally Zakir is shooting a series of videos which have a similar morbid theme covered, whilst with big scoops of humanity poured into them. All you guys lucky enough to have firsthanded experienced that joy, you might want to stay glued to Zakir Khan on social network sites.

It's a no brainer to connect the dots now. This moment should be remembered as one which should reinforce our firm belief in our administration, and more importantly, life again, and most importantly push us towards the end of the dark tunnel that we've gotten stuck in.

Zakir will leave by a flight tonight, pertinently unaware of the hidden blessing in what he had done, and probably and promptly laying down the road to more such wonderful surprises.

We really applaud the thinking and effort that went behind such an endeavor, mainly the VP, who seized the right moment by it's throbbing vein. We would very much like to see more such meaningful and brilliant moves in the future.

"A small push in the right direction can build bridges"

#Enroute_to_being_more_Sakt

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-09-2017 at 10:27PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Open IIT 2017-18 || Debate
The motion of the debate was “What is more important: our privacy or national security?”
The results are as follows:
Gold- Shashwata Mondal (45 points) & Anurag Mondal (45 points)
Silver- Abhinav Sharma (44 points)
Bronze- Nirmalya Panigrahi (43 points)

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates all the winners.

The motion stated, "What is more important, our privacy or national security?"
The results are as follows:

Silver: Abhinav Sharma (RK) | 44 points

Bronze: Nirmalya Panigrahi (Azad) | 43 points

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The online registration process for Joint Admission Test(JAM) for admission in M.Sc. courses in IITs and IISc is scheduled to begin from tomorrow i.e, September 5th, 2018. IIT Bombay is the convener of this coveted entrance examination this year. The deadline for the registration is October 10th and the examination is scheduled to be conducted on February 11th, 2018. The registration form for the same can be found at jam.iitb.ac.in. The detailed information regarding tentative schedule can be obtained through the attachment.

आईआईटी एवं आईआईएससी के MSc कोर्सेज में दाखिले के लिए संचालित किये जाने वाले जॉइंट एडमिशन टेस्ट (JAM 2018) के लिए ऑनलाइन रजिस्ट्रेशन प्रक्रिया की शुरुआत कल, 5 सितम्बर ,से शुरू होगी । इस वर्ष यह प्रवेश परीक्षा आईआईटी मुंबई द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही है । रजिस्ट्रेशन करने की अंतिम तिथि 10 अक्टूबर है तथा परीक्षा की तिथि 11 फरवरी,2018 निर्धारित की गयी है । रजिस्ट्रेशन के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएँ- jam.iitb.ac.in । कुछ अन्य महत्त्वपूर्ण तिथियां संलग्न चित्र में देखी जा सकती हैं ।
Souce: http://indiatoday.intoday...

Quiz Club

IIT Kharagpur Quiz Club shared The Scholars' Avenue's post.

The NSSC space quiz took place today at Vikramshila. The quizmaster for the event was Mr Somnath Chanda, a well-known name in Kolkata quizzing circles. It was his first quiz in IIT KGP and it lived up to expectations with a close finish. The final standings are as follows:
Winners:
Amit Kumar Ram, Ashutosh Dwivedi, Mayank Roy (120 points)
Runners-Up:
Baibhab Pattnaik, Judhajeet Basu, Siddhant (114 points)
Second runners-up:
Rishabh Madan, Sourav Kundu, Venkatesh Pai (84 points)

TSA congratulates the winners. We also congratulate the KGP quizzing contingent for their remarkable performances in recent quizzes and hope they cap it off with a strong showing in Nihilanth, the inter IIT and IIM quizzing fest.

  • Posted on 03-09-2017 at 11:44PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Teachers’ Day was celebrated in Netaji Auditorium today from 6 pm onwards. The event was organized by the Radha Krishnan Hall of Residence, with an appreciable attendance comprised of cultural performances by the students as well as the professors of the Institute. The students were privileged to have Professor Joy Sen on stage, playing the Sitar. Vocal performances were also delivered by Professor Seema Singh, Professor Anandrup Bhattacharya, and Professor P. Sandilya. Students presented a dance performance along with a play- 'The Third Wave' describing how an ideology strongly affects the society - be it in a positive or negative way. Some students gave solo performances as well. Also, the winners of the sketching competition held in the morning were awarded. The event came to an end with an address by the warden of the RK Hall. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur looks forward to having such successful events in future too.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 03-09-2017 at 10:54PM

The Scholar's Avenue

The institute has officially relaxed the ban on conducting trials in halls of residence for the purpose of participation in various Open IIT and inter-hall events. The message was conveyed via an email from the Dean of Student Affairs, Prof. Somesh Kumar and has instructed that decorum may be maintained through the length of sessions. The move follows an apparent state of complete lack of communication between seniors and juniors in halls following the original ban. The message also encouraged students to participate in events like Illumination and Rangoli. The hall council members are required to document the activities and present it to VP/warden/asst. warden.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 03-09-2017 at 12:20PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Continuing the tradition, Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence is celebrating the Teacher’s Day today at 6:00 pm in Netaji Auditorium. The event is being held today owing to an absence of holiday on 5th September. Last year, the function experienced very little attendance. Considering that it is an event held in the campus to show gratitude, respect, and admiration to our professors, we fervently urge the student community to mark their presence with all the enthusiasm and earnestly request all the professors and staff to kindly attend the function, bless the students and applaud the effort they put in organizing such an event.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 03-09-2017 at 12:20PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Continuing with the tradition, Radhakrishnan Hall of Residence is celebrating the Teacher’s Day today at 6:00 pm in Netaji Auditorium. The event is being held today owing to an absence of holiday on 5th September. Last year, the function experienced very little attendance considering that it is an event held in the campus to show gratitude, respect, and admiration to our professors. We fervently urge the student community to remain present with all the enthusiasm and earnestly request all the professors and staff to kindly attend the function, bless the students and applaud the effort they put in organizing such an event.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Researchers from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications, IIT Kharagpur have developed a visual technology that enables safer driving during rains. The technology removes from real-time video the obscuring effects of rain and displays it on the windscreen of vehicles to increase the clarity of driver’s view. Thus, it aims to enhance the transportation safety by providing on-screen visualization of clear videos in typical conditions.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 03-09-2017 at 09:50AM

Student Welfare Group

For those first years who missed the Panel Discussion on DepC, here are some wise words from the panelists that sum up almost everything important for making a department change. We hope you guys adhere to what they have advised.
Cheers!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 03-09-2017 at 09:01AM
The Scholar's Avenue

'Manthan', a panel discussion on how we perceive India to grow in the next five years, was organised in Netaji Auditorium at 5 P.M. on September 2, 2017.The event started with an introduction to the mighty imprints that India have had in the past on the world history. The dynamics of the modern world and how we, as a nation, thrive to maintain the pace with the world was intriguing enough to involve the audience, for the next hour. The event proceeded with an introduction to the panelists and a pledge taken by everyone present there, guided by Mayank Srivastava (V.P -T.S.G), which was driven by the thought of 'New India- In the making'. The panel discussion, followed the pledge and the panelists put forth their views on varied topics.

The panel comprised of the below listed professors and students:
• Prof. Rabibrata Mukherjee- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Prof. Somesh Kumar- Department of Mathematics
• Prof. Nabanita Dutta- Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture
• Sh. Pradip Pyne- Registrar, IIT kgp
• Prof. Manas Mandal- Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
• Ayushi Mrigen- Department of Mathematics
• Sutirtha Roy- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Mayank Srivastava- V.P.(T.S.G)

Topics ranging from evolution of science, existing mind-sets in the country, women empowerment, ease in connectivity and research opportunities to the impact that the current boost in the start-up culture has had on the society were discussed. The discussion concluded with the belief that if all the resources available are synchronized and a proactive approach to the issues is taken, the India of our dreams could be built in the next five years, in accordance with the theme “New India - 2022”. The event was conducted in association with ‘Skill India’ and MHRD.

The panel discussion was followed by concerts by ETMS and Krosswindz, a band from Kolkata, 6 PM onwards. The theme of music was patriotism.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 03-09-2017 at 09:01AM
The Scholar's Avenue

'Manthan', a panel discussion on how we perceive India to grow in the next five years, was organised in Netaji Auditorium at 5 P.M. on September 2, 2017.The event started with an introduction to the mighty imprints that India have had in the past on the world history. The dynamics of the modern world and how we, as a nation, thrive to maintain the pace with the world was intriguing enough to involve the audience, for the next hour. The event proceeded with an introduction to the panelists and a pledge taken by everyone present there, guided by Mayank Srivastava (V.P -T.S.G), which was driven by the thought of 'New India- In the making'. The panel discussion, followed the pledge and the panelists put forth their views on varied topics.

The panel comprised of the below listed professors and students:
• Prof. Rabibrata Mukherjee- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Prof. Somesh Kumar- Department of Mathematics
• Prof. Nabanita Dutta- Department of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architecture
• Sh. Pradip Pyne- Registrar, IIT kgp
• Prof. Manas Mandal- Department of Humanities and Social Sciences
• Ayushi Mrigen- Department of Mathematics
• Sutirtha Roy- Department of Chemical Engineering
• Mayank Srivastava- V.P.(T.S.G)

Topics ranging from evolution of science, existing mind-sets in the country, women empowerment, ease in connectivity and research opportunities to the impact that the current boost in the start-up culture has had on the society were discussed. The discussion concluded with the belief that if all the resources available are synchronized and a proactive approach to the issues is taken, the India of our dreams could be built in the next five years, in accordance with the theme “New India - 2022”. The event was conducted in association with ‘Skill India’ and MHRD.

The panel discussion was followed by concerts by ETMS, WTMS and Krosswindz, a band from Kolkata, 6 PM onward. The theme of music was patriotism.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 02-09-2017 at 08:45PM
The Scholar's Avenue

A candlelight march, leading up to GolC, was organised today by the Ambedkar Bhagat Singh Study Circle. It was organised in the aftermath of the suicide of 17-year old Anitha who fought against the NEET. Several political parties and students have come out on the streets demanding the scrapping of NEET.

You can read more about the story here: http://www.deccanchronicl...

  • Posted on 02-09-2017 at 07:06PM

The Scholar's Avenue

IIT-Kharagpur researchers have developed a visual technology that enables safer driving during rain.

The technology developed by researchers, led by Prof. Sudipta Mukhopadhyay, from the Department of Electronics and Electrical Communications removes from real-time video the obscuring effects of rain and displays it on the windscreen of vehicles to increase the clarity of driver's view.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 02-09-2017 at 11:14AM

International Relations Cell

It's an honour for us to meet the ex-chairman of the Nobel Prize Committee. We present you the excerpts from our discussion with Prof. Sven Lidin. It was an inspiring and engaging discussion where Prof. Lidin went to great length to describe what sets one apart, what is considered as world class research, how one can do great work and simply put: how one can get a Nobel Prize. He also talked about how India is rising and how Indians are contributing to research across the world. We encourage each and everyone to go through the interview description and get inspired.
https://www.linkedin.com/...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-09-2017 at 10:38PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

As directed by Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, IIT Kharagpur is celebrating 70 years of Independence and 75 years of Quit India Movement (SANKALP SE SIDDHI: Yeh India ka Time Hai) tomorrow, 2nd September 2017, at Netaji Auditorium. Tomorrow, there will be Manthan programme followed by a rock concert. Manthan programme will be from 4 pm to 5 pm. It is a brain-storming session/panel discussion on the theme 'New India 2022'. Rock concert will be from 6 pm to 8 pm. All the KGPians are cordially invited to witness the programme.

You can access this vast resource of knowledge by registering yourself at NDL portal.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The students of the Department of Architecture & Regional Planning - IIT Kharagpur have come up with a unique idea of tackling the problem of making choices which make us feel happy.
The Project titled “Happiness Project: What Made Me” is one among the three submissions from IIT Kharagpur for the prestigious Annual NASA Design Competition (ANDC). The problem statement was “We often turn a blind eye to unused/disused public spaces around us. Can Schools of Architecture create a positive social impact on these derelict urban spaces, by redesigning alternative spaces to have a larger social impact and to rebuild and improve them with small interventions?”
Our team found out the details about the project and have formulated the same in this report. Do give it a read.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/wm...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-09-2017 at 07:08PM

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Hello KGPians!
Examination Time Table for the upcoming Mid-Semester exam is out! The exam is scheduled to start on September 15th (Friday) and will end on September 25th (Monday). You can find the time table on your ERP --> Academic --> Examination Time Table --> Supplementary Examination TimeTable.
It should have come with the link "Examination Time Table (for Students), but due to some technical glitch, it's coming with the link "Supplementary Examination TimeTable".
Alternatively, you can find the same here as well: https://drive.google.com/...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the examinees all the best!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-09-2017 at 02:41PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Hello KGPians!
Examination Time Table for the upcoming Mid-Semester exam is out! The exam is scheduled to start on August 15th (Friday) and will end on August 25th (Monday). You can find the time table on your ERP --> Academic --> Examination Time Table --> Supplementary Examination TimeTable.
It should have come with the link "Examination Time Table (for Students), but due to some technical glitch, it's coming with the link "Supplementary Examination TimeTable".
Alternatively, you can find the same here as well: https://drive.google.com/...

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes all the examinees all the best!

Alumni Cell

With our illustrious alumni speakers, Mr Abhinav Sinha (COO OYO) and Mr Arnav Kumar (AVP SAIF Partners) and a very relatable discussion topic of mastering career trajectory, this Alumni Talk is a must attend for all KGPians looking to build a successful professional future.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The online registration process for GATE 2018 is scheduled to start from today i.e., September 1st by Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati. IIT Guwahati is the organizing institute of the coveted entrance exam this year. The last date for registration is October 5th. The exam is going to be held in February next year and the result is scheduled to be released on March 17th, 2018.Registration link: http://appsgate.iitg.ac.i...
GATE 2018 के लिए ऑनलाइन रजिस्ट्रेशन प्रक्रिया की शुरुआत आज, 1 सितम्बर, से होगी । इस वर्ष यह प्रवेश परीक्षा आईआईटी गुवाहाटी द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही है । रजिस्ट्रेशन करने की अंतिम तिथि 5 अक्टूबर निर्धारित की गयी है । परीक्षा का आयोजन अगले वर्ष फरवरी माह में किया जायेगा तथा परिणाम-घोषणा की तिथि 17 मार्च, 2018 निर्धारित की गयी है । रजिस्ट्रेशन के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएँ- http://appsgate.iitg.ac.in तथा अधिक जानकारी के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएं- http://gate.iitg.ac.in

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-09-2017 at 01:19PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

The online registration process for GATE 2018 is scheduled to start from today i.e., September 1st by Indian Institute of Technology, Guwahati. IIT Guwahati is the organizing institute of the coveted entrance exam this year. The last date for registration is October 5th. The exam is going to be held in February next year and the result is scheduled to be released on March 17th, 2018. The link for the registration is http://appsgate.iitg.ac.i... .
For more information, visit http://gate.iitg.ac.in .

GATE 2018 के लिए ऑनलाइन रजिस्ट्रेशन प्रक्रिया की शुरुआत आज, 1 सितम्बर, से होगी । इस वर्ष यह प्रवेश परीक्षा आईआईटी गुवाहाटी द्वारा आयोजित की जा रही है । रजिस्ट्रेशन करने की अंतिम तिथि 5 अक्टूबर निर्धारित की गयी है । परीक्षा का आयोजन अगले वर्ष फरवरी माह में किया जायेगा तथा परिणाम-घोषणा की तिथि 17 मार्च, 2018 निर्धारित की गयी है । रजिस्ट्रेशन के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएँ- http://appsgate.iitg.ac.in तथा अधिक जानकारी के लिए इस लिंक पर जाएं- http://gate.iitg.ac.in

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-09-2017 at 12:58PM
Technology Students Gymkhana

National Students’ Space Challenge, 2017 proudly presents Vikram Sarabhai Space Exhibition by Space Applications Centre, ISRO.

All students are requested to attend Vikramshila Complex to be a part of the exhibition. The exhibition is scheduled for 1-3 September, 2017 from 10 am to 6 pm. Set of panels related to Remote Sensing Satellites, Communication Satellite and their applications

1. Chandrayaan/ Mars mission, models of camera of Mars Mission, satellite images of Mars and Chandrayan

2. Scaled down models of launch vehicles like PSLV, GSLV and Mk III

3. Various satellite models of INSAT, IRS, Oceansat, Aryabhatta, Bhaskara, RISAT, Resourcesat, DAT, Apple, etc.

4. A working model showing satellites orbiting around earth.

5. Video documentaries show on mars mission and chandrayaan mission.

6. Videos on how to join ISRO - IIST

7. Mechanical / Electronic components, parts used in satellites will also be displayed.

8. ISRO’s Geo portal-BHUVAN website will be demonstrated during the exhibition.

Senior Scientist/Engineers from Space Applications Centre will remain present during the exhibition event & interact with visitors/students.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-09-2017 at 08:34AM
