  • Posted on 23-07-2017 at 02:08PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

According to a recent report by Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) of India for the year ended March 2016, avoidable expenses and irregularities at some of the IITs have cost Rs. 18.03 crores. In this Compliance Audit Observations report, these are some of the few points made about these irregularities:
1) Idle expenditure: Failure on the part of the IIT Roorkee to construct sewer line across NH-58 and STP at Roorkee and Saharanpur campuses resulted in an idle expenditure of Rs. 15.06 crore incurred on the construction of sewer line which could not be utilised even after the lapse of more than four years from the scheduled date of completion.

2) Irregular payment of Service Tax: IIT Roorkee made payment of service tax amounting to Rs. 1.34 crores on the outsourced services, although these services were exempted from payment of such tax. Same goes for IIT Patna with Rs. 8.36 crores.

3) Avoidable expenditure towards penal charges on electricity consumption: IIT Madras had incurred an avoidable expenditure of Rs. 1.05 crores towards penalty for exceeding contracted demand during April 2013 to March 2016 due to non-review and enhancement of sanctioned demand.

4) Irregular waiver of overpayment: The Board of Governors of IIT Jodhpur irregularly waived recovery of excess payment amounting to Rs. 59.38 lakhs made to its faculty, which is now under recovery at the instance of Audit.

5) Irregular reimbursement of LTC (Leave Travel Concession) claims by Central Autonomous Bodies: Central Autonomous Bodies irregularly reimbursed air fares of Rs. 6.90 crores during 2012-16 against the air tickets purchased by their employees from unauthorised agents in violation of the MoF guidelines for availing Leave Travel Concession. IIT Kharagpur, despite delayed submission of claims, did not recover LTC advance of Rs. 1.14 crore of which Rs. 19.85 lakh was to be forfeited. Cross verification of claims with the Airlines also revealed that the air fares reimbursed by the IIT Kharagpur and IIT Bombay were inflated by Rs. 18.56 lakhs (11.21 lakhs for IIT Kharagpur, 7.35 lakhs for IIT Bombay).

CAG Audit Report Source: http://www.cag.gov.in/sit...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-07-2017 at 08:00PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

"If there were ever to be another Ajit and you could swap me for him, don't hesitate. Make the trade!", said Warren Buffett, chairman of the board, about Ajit Jain in a letter to Berkshire shareholders in 2016.
Ajit Jain, an IIT Kharagpur alumnus, President of Berkshire Hathaway Insurance group and one of the two potential successors to legendary investor Warren Buffett has donated stocks of the company to IITKGP USA Foundation for his alma mater IIT Kharagpur. Jain is touted to be one of the two favoured candidates as eventual successor of Berkshire Hathaway founder and CEO Buffett.
Ajit Jain, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, graduated with B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering in the year 1972. In 1978, he moved to the United States, where he earned an MBA from Harvard University. After graduation, he held various positions at top tier management consultancy McKinsey & Co., up until 1986 when he joined Berkshire Hathaway. He is currently the President of Berkshire Hathaway Insurance group and leads several other insurance companies housed inside the broader Berkshire Group.
It's quite a unique gesture as the institute has been receiving only monetary donations till now. “Ajit is very close and dear to Warren Buffett. Warren considers him like his own son. We are proud to have our alumni so valuable to Warren Buffett,” said Mr. Vinod Gupta, another famous distinguished alumnus who pioneered big-ticket alumni contributions to IIT Kharagpur with a $2 million-plus donation in the Nineties.

Source: https://www.telegraphindi...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-07-2017 at 08:00PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

"If there were ever to be another Ajit and you could swap me for him, don't hesitate. Make the trade!", said Warren Buffett, chairman of the board, about Ajit Jain in a letter to Berkshire shareholders in 2016.
Ajit Jain, an IIT Kharagpur alumnus, President of Berkshire Hathaway Insurance group and one of the two potential successors to legendary investor Warren Buffett has donated stocks of the company to IITKGP USA Foundation for his alma mater. IIT Kharagpur. Jain is touted to be one of the two favoured candidates as eventual successor of Berkshire Hathaway founder and CEO Buffett.
Ajit Jain, a distinguished alumnus of IIT Kharagpur, graduated with B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering in the year 1972. In 1978, he moved to the United States, where he earned an MBA from Harvard University. After graduation, he held various positions at top tier management consultancy McKinsey & Co., up until 1986 when he joined Berkshire Hathaway. Technology Students Gymkhana

IMS Learning Resources is an India-based training company preparing students for entrance examinations for competitive and professional courses. The Institute is conducting a "National Scholarship Test" to expose and encourage you to start your preparations early. Communiqué IIT Kharagpur, in association with IMS Learning Resources, is going to conduct this test in our campus.

The format of the Test:-
Type: Objective Questions (+3/-1)
Sections: Quantitative and Verbal Ability, Reading Comprehension, Data & Logical Reasoning
Time: 90 min

The test is free of cost and every student gets a scholarship from 10% to 100% on Classroom Programs depending on percentile and ranking.

Registration Link - https://goo.gl/forms/1zmn...
Eligibility - 2nd-year UG-5th year UG
Date - 23rd July, Sunday
Reporting time - 1:30 PM
Test Duration - 1.5 hrs ( 2 to 3:30 PM)
Venue - NR121, Nalanda Complex

ON SPOT REGISTRATIONS ARE AVAILABLE

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Students of IIT Kharagpur have again made us all proud with their stupendous performance in Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship (QInF) program, 2017. Three out of six winners are from IIT Kharagpur and the other three includes one team each from IIT Bombay, IIIT Hyderabad and IIsc Bangalore. These six winning teams will receive a financial award of INR 10 lakhs (approx. $15,000) each for the academic year 2017-18 and mentorship from Qualcomm engineers. This program recognises, rewards and mentors innovative graduate students across a broad range of technical research.
The winning teams from IIT Kharagpur are:
1) Avisek Lahiri and Abhinav Agarwalla from The Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, recommended by Prof. Prabir Kumar Biswas and Prof. Pabitra Mitra for their proposal on “Domain adversarial networks for bridging cross domain semantic gaps in computer vision”.
2) Sayandeep Saha and Sikhar Patranabis from The Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, recommended by Prof. Debdeep Mukhopadhyay and Prof. Pallab Dasgupta for their proposal on “Automating fault based cryptanalysis in secure embedded applications using machine learning”.
3) Preety Priya and Sucharita Chakraborty from The Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, recommended by Prof. Debarati Sen for their proposal on “Blind joint equalization and detection in presence of non-linearity and synchronization errors for millimeter wave communications”.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the winners and wishes them all the best for their future endeavours.

Source: https://www.qualcomm.com/...

  • Posted on 21-07-2017 at 09:44PM
Kshitij

The entire world stands shattered with the demise of one of the most gifted contemporary artists of all time.
This serves as a reality check for everyone and goes to show that depression is indeed very real.
Our social initiative Astitva launched last year aimed to address the stigma around mental health.
Although a person may seem jovial from outside, but one doesn't really know if they're facing issues in their lives. The best thing one can do is to reach out and pay heed to their silent cries for help, that often go unheard.

Rest in peace, Chester Bennington. You will be dearly missed.

Business Club

Tinder may seem like a simple tool with primitive ruling functions that we look up to, when we want to lose the ‘single’ status. But did you know that Tinder functions more like a free market with the same complex psychological and physical decision-making practices? In fact, it may be operating even better than today’s average market economy. Interested? We bet you are!

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Supreme Court has stayed ongoing counselling as well as admissions for IITs, NITs and other engineering colleges till further orders. With this, the future of around 33,000 students, who have already been allotted seats in various colleges, hangs in balance. A bench of Justice Dipak Mishra and A M Khanwikar took this decision over the issue of bonus marks being awarded to all the students for wrong questions in the entrance exam.The bench has scheduled the next hearing on July 10.
Source: http://timesofindia.india...

The Scholar's Avenue

The proxy address for internet access is being changed to "172.16.2.30" by CIC for technical reasons related to upgradation of backend proxy servers. Users are requested to start using this new proxy address for internet access immediately instead of the existing address (10.3.100.207). For any problem with accessing the internet with the new proxy address, users are requested to report the problem to helpdesk@cc.iitkgp.ernet.in.

The old proxy address (10.3.100.207) will also continue to be operational for some more time until further notice and will be taken off (with due notice beforehand) sometimes in end-July/early-August after the new proxy is stabilized. However, users are strongly recommended to start using the new proxy address immediately and report any problems to CIC helpdesk as the proxy address will change to this new one by end-July/early-August anyway.

All other settings such as the existing proxy bypass i.e. "No Proxy for 10.0.0.0/8, .iitkgp.ernet.in and .iitkgp.ac.in" for internal servers will remain same for now. We request all to shift to the new address asap to help CIC root out any teething problems that may occur. Your cooperation is deeply appreciated.

regards
---------
CIC Support

  • Posted on 05-07-2017 at 02:08PM
CodeClub

With the aim to make Computer Science research at IIT Kharagpur more inclusive, we seek to share and discuss some of the distinguished results and insights from work of research scholars, starting from the recent work on a new temporal model for evolving citation networks.

This work by research scholars Mayank Singh & Rajdeep Sarkar and Prof. Pawan Goyal, Prof. Animesh Mukherjee has been accepted to ACM SIGKDD 2017, one of the top CS conference in the area of Data Mining; in-fact being the only paper from India to get accepted to KDD. The attached video provides a concise summary of the model and results, and is also in competition with other accepted works wrt total views, so please do make sure to watch and share!

As a fundamental goal of CSURG is to initiate and foster research interest at an early stage for undergrads, we'll also be looking forward to work towards providing an overview of such excellent work in a way that requires low background-knowledge on reader's part 😀!

Full paper is available at https://arxiv.org/pdf/160...

https://www.youtube.com/w...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-07-2017 at 03:10PM
CodeClub

What is the destiny of your research paper? Is it going to be increasingly popular OR shall it lose its popularity as time passes by? What other papers would gain from the loss of this popularity?

We answer some of these interesting questions in our work on modeling how the flow of citations, coming to a paper, is diverted to other research papers. This work has been accepted among 131 (out of 748 submissions) research ideas from all around the globe in one of the top CS conferences in the area of Data Mining and Data Sciences (ACM SIGKDD 2017). This is the ONLY work from India that got through this time in SIGKDD.

In this work, we talk about how research papers that get older by time lose their potential citations. We prove that new papers that cite these older papers steal the incoming citations. We also prove that this stealing (or relaying from the old to the new) effect becomes more prominent as time passes by.

Please help our team to compete with others in having maximum view count of our Youtube video. WATCH, LIKE and SHARE it to your friends as much as possible. Make it the MOST WATCHED VIDEO among all projects.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 04-07-2017 at 10:44AM
Autonomous Ground Vehicle

Self-driving cars are coming — sooner than you think. But when will we get there, and how will we get there?

Two terms for the transition have become standard in the auto industry. There's the "evolutionary" path to autonomous vehicles, where today's cars get self-driving features bit by bit — Tesla's autopilot feature, for example. And then there's the "revolutionary" path. That's where totally self-driving cars, like the ones Google is working on, start as test vehicles and become more mainstream as they can drive in more places.
There's an ongoing debate over which path is the safer one. But these paths will eventually converge.

Today's most advanced semi-autonomous features can be found in Tesla's and a few other cars that allow drivers to take their hands off the steering wheel on a highway. Using a series of sensors and cameras, cars can also merge, self-park, stay within a lane and brake as needed.

This tech works particularly well for commercial trucks that operate on highways. Companies like Peloton and NXP are "platooning" trucks — tying them together through a vehicle-to-vehicle communication system. A "pilot" truck drives while those behind can sit and relax.

Google and Ford are testing self-driving cars in structured environments like test tracks, as well as cities with relatively light traffic, like Austin, Texas and Mountain View, Calif. Vehicles travel at slow speeds — up to 25 miles an hour — while gathering data on pedestrians and human drivers; they are also starting to drive at night, and in rain and snow.

By 2019, Driver-assistance features will get more sophisticated, and will sync up with GPS and navigation. So a driver should be able to input a destination while driving on a highway, turn on adaptive cruise control and let the car drive itself. When it gets to the appropriate exit, the car will return control to the driver.

In the USA, NHTSA (NATIONAL HIGHWAYS TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION) has begun working on rules for testing and deployment of fully autonomous vehicles, without a driver, across the country. In the meantime, companies like Google will be racking up miles to gather data about every single type of situation a self-driving vehicle might encounter; mapping companies will gather as much 3D data in major cities as possible. Car makers and tech companies will have to make sure light detection and ranging (lidar) and radar sensors, as well as cameras and GPS, can work together, while ensuring that each component can function independently if one of them fails
.
Companies will also be testing vehicles in all climates and environments, including rain and snow. They'll also test cars in more places, moving from test tracks and low-density cities to roads with more foot and vehicle traffic.

Commercial trucks will likely be the first vehicles to hit the road autonomously, if state and federal regulators give them them the go-ahead to work on highways.

Here is one such article on the legislation making rounds in the Congress for federal rules on self driving cars to supersede state and local regulations :

https://www.wired.com/sto...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 02-07-2017 at 02:09PM
Metakgp

Metakgp shared Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS's post.

Whenever Apple releases a new version of the IPhone, a vast majority of users will flock to buy the current version, although previous versions are still well in use. This particular trend is observable in may real-life scenarios , recent publications are able to improve upon previously done work and hence relay in more citations, recent supreme court cases become famous because laws evolve and change with time.
This dynamic evolution of networks is presented wonderfully in this video. Do give it a watch.

https://www.youtube.com/w...

The Scholar's Avenue

We can be prepared for a more detailed induction programme from this semester onwards, it seems. This should go a long way in helping out students if implemented properly.

"Instead of one-time induction, refurbishing programmes have been planned round the year. For students of second year, an assimilation programme to departments and academics would be introduced. For third year students, a reorientation programme for pathway choices have been developed. In fourth year, the students would undergo a de-induction programme which would make them ready to face the world beyond the realms of family and educational institutions."

The recent unfortunate events led the Institute to curb the causes of the same and we must say that these all are welcome steps and it's the way forward. Read out the full story for more details.

The KGPian Game Theory Society

The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's photo.

Today ,the IGTS team wishes our Founder President and Mentor Manoj Gadia a very Happy Birthday ! Under his guidance the last academic session has been quite a journey with IGTS organizing its events and spreading game theory across many campuses in India. Our DTU and IIM Rohtak chapters established in the last session also complete 1 year today. Here's hoping we continue to set new milestones in the upcoming session under his leadership. :)

Branding And Relations Cell

IIT Kharagpur with a motive to foster scientific creativity and enthusiasm amongst the school children, declares the first edition of Young Innovators' Program organized by Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur. Young Innovators' Program-2017 welcomes student from classes 8, 9 and 10 to come up with scientific solutions to the current global problems in the given themes. Organised in 4 rounds, 30 best teams will get an opportunity to present their ideation at IIT Kharagpur.

Explore the website to know more: www.barciitkgp.com

  • Posted on 08-06-2017 at 07:03PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

|| QS World Rankings ||
QS World University Rankings, one of the most trusted rankings around the world, are out! MIT, Stanford and Harvard University have bagged first three positions respectively. Among Indian institutions, IIT Delhi tops the list with a world rank of 172. Just behind IIT Delhi, IIT Bombay and IISc Bangalore are there with ranks of 179 and 190, respectively. This is the first time that three Indian institutions have made it to top 200 in this list. IIT Kharagpur has improved its rank as compared to previous year and bagged a world rank of 308. The parameters that are taken into consideration for the rankings include academic reputation, employer reputation, student faculty ratio, citations per faculty, international faculty, international students etc.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-06-2017 at 11:02PM

#RoboCup #KRSSGForever

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

IIT Kharagpur ranks 3rd in the number of selections in Google Summer of Code, 2017 program with 31 selections. This is a jump of 4 positions from the 7th rank in 2016. Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur congratulates the student community and wishes that the open-source culture keep flourishing in the campus!
https://opensource.google...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 07-06-2017 at 11:07AM
Kharagpur Open Source Society

Google Summer of Code statistics are out, and we are glad to announce that we had a whopping 31 selections from IIT Kharagpur this year, which is more than double of last year.

Worldwide, IIT KGP stands 3rd in the list of number of students getting selected, after IIIT Hyderabad (39) and BITS Pilani (37).

Moreover, India stands undefeated among having the total number of students getting selected, since last 5 years. This year, India had 569 of its applications getting selected, with US standing second (126 selections).

This clearly shows the growing trend of Open-Source development, and we strive to bring and involve more number of people into Open Source :)

For more information, visit the blog.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-06-2017 at 04:32PM
Technology Literary Society

For our people, who shall leave us after one final goodbye, we prepare a Souvenir.
For this to convey deep meanings and beautiful memories, we need your messages, your own words !
TLS invites all KGPians to send in their creative works (poems, articles, experiences, photos) for the Annual Institute Magazine ALANKAR at tlsblogs@ gmail.com .
Works related to Kgp will be appreciated.

Design credits: Divyanshu Minz and Kamal Gurnani

The Scholar's Avenue

The Scholars' Avenue would like to bring notice to its readers about a Quantitative Research Summer Training Program that is being offered by WorldQuant from 1st June to 31st July, 2017. You can take a look at the details of the training below:

WorldQuant Summer Training Program

Based on the success of last year’s Quantitative Research Summer Training Program, we would like to invite applicants for the 2017 program.
Our program offers distinctive hands-on experience in developing mathematical or quantitative models using our web-based stock simulation platform (Websim). With over 1300 registrations, 62 students across various schools in India qualified for the 2016 Summer Training Program to become Research Consultants with WorldQuant.

Our Summer Training Program is designed to offer insight into the quantitative model building space. The virtual training program is a unique learning opportunity within the investment management industry. It is a tailored program that combines virtual training and workshop sessions in developing alphas/trading models.
If you show potential and demonstrate exceptional performance during your time with us, you may be offered a part-time Research Consultant position with us.

Below are a few key highlights of the Summer Training Program:
Ø Regular online training sessions;

Ø Mentoring and guidance from experienced quantitative researchers;

Ø Eligible participants have the potential of being considered for a Research Consultant opportunity at the end of program, which may include aone-time special stipend of up to 1,00,000 INR;

Ø Certificate from WorldQuant.

Participation Requirements:

Hold or working towards Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Finance or any other related field that ishighly analytical and quantitative
1st and 2nd year students will be given preference
Have a strong interest in learning about worldwide financial markets
Submit applications to your placement team
Register for a Websim account [ https://websim.worldquant... ] If you have already expressed interest through your institution’s placement office, please make sure you sign up for an account using the same email address. Please fill out your academic profile when applying for a new account.
On Websim, when prompted, please confirm your interest in being considered for the Summer Training Program.
Space in the program is limited, so selection of candidates for the program will be based on the applicant’s activity in Websim and academic achievement among other factors.

Training Program Completion:
Trainees who attend all scheduled training sessions, complete assignments and build a score on Websim based on the alphas they submit will receive a completion certificate at the end of the training program.
In addition, we may offer Research Consultant positions to candidates who complete the training successfully, and a one-time special stipend maybe awarded to outstanding performers upon becoming a Research Consultant.
Research Consultant offers are at our sole discretion and are subject to a background check and other applicable eligibility requirements.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-06-2017 at 01:21PM
The Scholar's Avenue

The Scholars' Avenue would like to bring notice to its readers about a Quantitative Research Summer Training Program that is being offered by WorldQuant from 1st June to 31st July, 2017. You can take a look at the details of the training below:

WorldQuant Summer Training Program

Based on the success of last year’s Quantitative Research Summer Training Program, we would like to invite applicants for the 2017 program.
Our program offers distinctive hands-on experience in developing mathematical or quantitative models using our web-based stock simulation platform (Websim). With over 1300 registrations, 62 students across various schools in India qualified for the 2016 Summer Training Program to become Research Consultants with WorldQuant.

Our Summer Training Program is designed to offer insight into the quantitative model building space. The virtual training program is a unique learning opportunity within the investment management industry. It is a tailored program that combines virtual training and workshop sessions in developing alphas/trading models.
If you show potential and demonstrate exceptional performance during your time with us, you may be offered a part-time Research Consultant position with us.

Below are a few key highlights of the Summer Training Program:
Ø Regular online training sessions;

Ø Mentoring and guidance from experienced quantitative researchers;

Ø Eligible participants have the potential of being considered for a Research Consultant opportunity at the end of program, which may include aone-time special stipend of up to 1,00,000 INR;

Ø Certificate from WorldQuant.

Participation Requirements:

Hold or working towards Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Finance or any other related field that ishighly analytical and quantitative
1st and 2nd year students will be given preference
Have a strong interest in learning about worldwide financial markets
Submit applications to your placement team
Register for a Websim account [ https://websim.worldquant... ] If you have already expressed interest through your institution’s placement office, please make sure you sign up for an account using the same email address. Please fill out your academic profile when applying for a new account.
On Websim, when prompted, please confirm your interest in being considered for the Summer Training Program.
Space in the program is limited, so selection of candidates for the program will be based on the applicant’s activity in Websim and academic achievement among other factors.

Training Program Completion:
Trainees who attend all scheduled training sessions, complete assignments and build a score on Websim based on the alphas they submit will receive a completion certificate at the end of the training program.
In addition, we may offer Research Consultant positions to candidates who complete the training successfully, and a one-time special stipend maybe awarded to outstanding performers upon becoming a Research Consultant.
Research Consultant offers are at our sole discretion and are subject to a background check and other applicable eligibility requirements.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur shared a group.

JEE Main, JEE Advanced, BITSAT and other engineering entrance exams have taken place and few of them already have their results out. Rest of the results will also be out in a couple of weeks. Now that ranks of various entrance exams are out (or will be out), its equally important for the aspirants to get acquainted with all the required information and only then choose their branch and college. For that, there is a need of such a platform for proper counselling where aspirants can get information and advice, so that they can make better decisions. To serve this purpose, Student Welfare Group (SWG) IIT Kharagpur has taken an initiative and formed a JEE Counselling group (link below). All the aspirants looking for joining college this year as well as students who are already in colleges and hence, can help out aspirants with their experiences, are requested to join this group.
https://www.facebook.com/...

The Scholar's Avenue

Two of our students Sahashranshu Maurya and Somrup Chakraborty have been selected to represent our institute on the international stage this year, through their team TAKNIQUEE, which has been shortlisted for the finals of the Shell Ideas 360 2016/2017, a student collaborative programme which features in the list of top ten student competitions in the world. The winner would be chosen through a voting platform, called the Audience Choice Awards.
TAKNIQUEE from IIT KGP has come up with an innovative approach to tackle the energy problem and achieve cooling in the midst of summers using an energy-friendly approach. The name of their idea is "Passive Solar Water Wall".
They will be fighting it out for the maximum number of votes with 4 other universities, namely, Nanyang Technological University (Singapore), Delft University of Technology (Netherlands), University of Texas at Austin (USA) and University of Cambridge (UK), who themselves have put forth new ways to tip the energy scale.

You can showcase your support to the team by voting for the team at the link provided below. The voting will close on the 23rd of May and the results will be announced on the 25th of May. The team will be on it's way to London on the 24th of May to give a final presentation.

For more details about the teams and their ideas, as well as for voting for our team, please visit

http://www.shellideas360....

The Scholars' Avenue congratulates the team and wishes it all the best for the finals.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 16-05-2017 at 11:08PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

No CFC emission, no carbon emission, negligible electricity usage and almost 50% reduction in the cooling cost, have we ever thought of such type of air conditioning system in our house? Well never! But, two talented minds of IIT Kharagpur, Sahashranshu Maurya and Somrup Chakraborty(Department of Geology and Geophysics), have come up with a unique idea to challenge the climate change, global warming and many other environmental issues (listen the full idea here: https://vimeo.com/2122331... ).
This year in Shell Ideas360, over 17000 students collaborated to share over 750 innovative ideas to tackle the pressures on the world’s energy, water and food resources. Through the various stages and rigrous selection process finally five ideas have been shortlisted for Audience Choice Award at #makethefuture Live in London. Passive Solar Water Wall, by team "Takniquee" from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, is one of the five ideas shortlisted.
The team with the highest number of votes will receive the Audience Choice Award 2016-17. The voting period is from May 13 to May 23, 2017. We request to every students of IIT Kharagpur to vote in a large number to support the team "Takniquee" and make them win the contest by large margin.
Cast your vote here: shellideas360.com/audienc...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 14-05-2017 at 05:51PM
CodeClub

With an exciting time ahead for high impact research in CS, the Computer Science Undergraduate Research Group marks a new initiative for cultivating a culture of research and innovation among undergrads and bringing them together with the community of grad students and professors early in their academic career.

In its pilot-testing phase, CSURG achieves tremendous success with acceptance of the research paper "Social Media Advertisement Outreach: Learning the Role of Aesthetics" to ACM SIGIR 2017, renowned as the world's most prestigious conference in Information Retrieval. The work comes from the independent effort of 4 third year undergrads, Avikalp Srivastava, Madhav Datt, Jaikrishna Ch & Shubham Mangla and highlights the potential of research at the undergraduate level that remains untapped at most Indian universities.

With this success, CSURG is now growing, and hopes to induct highly motivated undergrads, and work closely with with PhD scholars, CNERG - Complex Networks Research Group, IIT Kharagpur and research groups with an aim to mentor and familiarise students with research at an early stage, and enable them to publish high quality and impact work to top-tier conferences and journals.

All of us at CSURG are extremely excited about working with undergraduates and are looking forward to an enthusiastic participation. Cheers!

  • Posted on 13-05-2017 at 10:55PM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

Update on the Tragic Accident.

The primary investigation of the accident by the Andhra Pradesh Police which today shook the entire KGP family unfolded the identification of the deceased and the cause of the accident. The bereaved N Ravi Teja, 27, a Software Engineer at Oracle, Hyderabad, T Rohith, 28, a Software Development Engineer at Amazon, Hyderabad and P Surya Teja, 27, Principal Software Engineer at ZeMoSo Technologies, Hyderabad all belonged to the 2011 batch of IIT Kharagpur.
Surya Teja who was at the steering of the Hyundai Verna, tried to overtake a DCM van from the left side with the car believed to be speeding at about 120 kmph rammed into the side railing after clashing with the van, said P Laxmikanth Reddy, senior inspector, Andhra Pradesh Police. He further added that the driver of the van cannot be blamed as he was driving in the the third lane of the four lane Ring Road at a speed less than 80 kmph which is legitimate. Although a case has been registered under sections 304-A and 337 of the Indian Penal Code against the van driver who himself is undergoing treatment for his head injuries. The police also said that none of the youngsters were wearing seat belt.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur urges everyone to carefully follow the traffic rules with full security and safety measures while travelling to avert such untoward happenings.

With inputs from Deccan Chronicle and The New Indian Express.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 13-05-2017 at 11:40AM
The Scholar's Avenue

We are very sorry to inform you that 4 Alumni of IIT KGP met with an accident in Hyderabad today morning at 7:40, out of which 3 succumbed to death. All of them were graduates working in different IT firms. They were to attend a marriage when they met with this fatal mishap after being grazed by a truck. Ravi Teja and Surya Teja died on the spot, while Rohit breathed his last during the treatment.

We offer condolences to their families, and pray with all our hearts that this unfortunate trend of deaths in/related to our institute does not continue any further.

http://www.newindianexpre...

  • View the post
  • Posted on 13-05-2017 at 10:09AM
Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

In what came as a shock to the institute, three graduates of IIT Kharagpur, Ravi Teja, Surya Teja and Rohith lost their life in a road mishap on Outer Ring Road at Tukkuguda on the outskirts of Hyderabad yesterday. They were travelling by a car from Gachibowli to Khammam to attend a marriage when the vehicle was grazed by a truck coming from opposite direction. The car swerved, hit side-railing of the road and overturned killing Ravi and Surya on the spot while Rohith succumbed to head injuries at a nearby hospital.

Our heart goes with the family and friends of the deceased and may the departed souls rest in peace.

Awaaz IIT Kharagpur

With the motive of solving major engineering and technology challenges in the country and addressing the societal needs and achieving national prosperity, a first-of-its-kind Pan IIT and IISc joint initiative, IMPRINT, drafted through MHRD is going to witness the country's first knowledge centre at IIT Kharagpur on Formal Methods on Safety Critical Systems. The centre would function as a networked knowledge research centre in collaboration with IIT Kanpur and IIT Bombay.

  • Posted on 01-05-2017 at 06:42PM
Branding And Relations Cell

Deakin University and Coventry University is jointly offering a PhD scholarship (Co-tutelle) on the topic of ‘Repair of Superalloy Components by Laser Engineered Net Shaping’
We are inviting students who have recently completed their Master’s program in Materials or Metallurgical engineering with the following essential eligibility criteria –
• First Class scores of above 80% in the final exams at Graduation and Post-Graduation level.
• Candidates with publications are preferred
• IELTS (Overall 6.5 with no band less than 6)
Interested candidates can send CV & research proposal to Ms. Ruby Majumdar at ruby.majumdar@deakin.edu.au before 10th May 2017.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 01-05-2017 at 06:41PM
Branding And Relations Cell

Deakin University, Australia is offering fully funded On Campus PhD positions in the area of Data Analytics/Machine Learning at the Centre of Pattern Recognition and Data Analytics (PRaDA). The eligibility criteria is –
• Graduates preferred from the area of Maths/Stats/Electrical/Machine Learning/Computer Science
• Candidates with 80% in both UG and PG level will be preferred
• Mandatory IELTS scores required (Band 6.5/6)
Please send updated CV & research proposal to Ms. Ruby Majumdar at ruby.majumdar@deakin.edu.au by 10th May 2017.

The Scholar's Avenue

Here, we are sharing the story of Vivek Kumar, an alumnus of 2014 who was diagnosed with a tumor in December 2015. In his own words "When you are on an edge where two sides are life and death, you understand the value of the gift called life." :)

Technology Students Gymkhana

Two posts of General Secretary (Students’ Welfare) i.e. 01 male and 01 female is to be created from Autumn Semester 2017-18.

Application are invited for the said posts latest by 26th April 2017, to be submitted at T.S.G., Criteria for the posts remain same as for the other G.Sec. posts of TSG.

Submit your applications mentioning your basic details in the main Gymkhana Office to Mr. Prithwiraj Mahto before the deadline.

The Scholar's Avenue

As part of our series on overcoming depression, here's sharing Debanjana's story. She's successfully overcome her depression and in line with her childhood dream is going to the US for PhD. Cheers to life, indeed! :)

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-04-2017 at 08:55PM
The Scholar's Avenue

In the light of recent events, The Scholars' Avenue is sharing stories from people on campus who've successfully dealt with depression.

Here's the story of Charan Raj, a student of IIT Kharagpur and his astounding account of fighting VITILIGO and depression. If you too are battling with depression or suicidal thoughts or have successfully overcome them, you are welcome to share your story via TSA open blog( https://tsablog.quora.com... /)

For those suffering out there, you are not alone. Your difficulties are not unsurmountable as attested to, by brave people like Charan. Please don't give up, please reach out, we are here to help you. :)

Technology IIT KGP

The Annual Gymkhana Award Ceremony was held on the 18th of April at the Netaji Auditorium.

The ceremony saw the winners of the Gymkhana Awards in Technology, the 5th Inter IIT Tech Meet and the Technology General Championship being felicitated for their efforts and excellence.

The Technology Students' Gymkhana would like to congratulate all the awardees, and wishes them all the best for their future.

We are curating a list of all the Faculty Advisors, we have managed to get some names but still we have a lot of missing data. It is time for you to contribute towards the Wiki. It will take only a minute. We just need your FacAd's name, your department and your year of joining.
You can contribute by:
1. Directly editing the wiki page at https://wiki.metakgp.org/... (Preferred)

2. Filling the google form: http://www.ccode.ml/metak...

Together let us make the Wiki great.
Cheers!

Technology Students Gymkhana

The Annual Gymkhana Awards Ceremony will be conducted at the Netaji Auditorium from 6.30pm onwards today. All medal winners, award winners and cup winners will be felicitated at the ceremony, and the annual reports will be read out by the outgoing office bearers, as the new office bearers are welcomed into the fold.

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur invites the entire student community of IIT Kharagpur to be a part of the proceedings and make this event a success!!

Metakgp

We are organising the second "MetaKGP Talks" on April 13th (7PM-8PM) at Maggu Room(F127, Main Building). There will be two talks:
1. Ashris Choudhury and Ankita Diwan (Final year B.Arch):
Speaking on “Building future together : Artists and Engineers”. The talk explores the messy process of creativity shedding light on how innovation is a blend of analysis and synthesis. Ashris and Ankita talk about the importance of collaboration and discussion between the engineers and artists to make innovation happen fluidly.
2. Abhishek Tripathi (Member at TLS):
Speaking on “Poetry, Collaboration and People - Sublimation of knowledge by doing and seeing”. The talk would be related to Abhishek's experience of learning from people, literature and history.
We hope to see you there with your friends!

Technology IIT KGP

Gymkhana awards 2016 - 2017

Application for the gymkhana awards in the genre of technology are invited for
1) Prof. G S Sanyal Cup.
2) Order of merit.
3) Hon'ble mention.
4) Ashoke Mukherjee Cup (Outgoing student who has made outstanding voluntary contribution to the Gymkhana)
CVs should be emailed to tech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 11/04/2017 at 6 pm. All the relevant documents (supporting points mentioned in the CV) should be mailed along with the CV.
In the resumes following information can be included:
*Participation in the GC.
*Position of responsibilities.
*Participation in tech events (eg. KTJ, out station participation).
*Inter IIT Tech achievements.
*Meaningful projects and technical papers.
*National/International conferences.
Regards

Kharagpur Open Source Society

Kharagpur Open Source Society - KOSS shared Metakgp's photo.

We are going to have the first 2 MetaKGP Talks on April 3rd (7PM-8PM) at Maggu Room (F127, Main Building).
We have two speakers:
1. Harsh Gupta (Participated in the Google Summer of Code 2014, volunteer with #SaveTheInternet Coalition) - Speaking on “Politics of Tech". The talk would be related to the speaker’s experience of working with “#SaveTheInternet” coalition that lead the pro-net neutrality campaign last year, against a proposed TRAI regulation.
2. Atal Ashutosh Agarwal (Former Vice President, Gymkhana) - Speaking on “Kgp learnings beyond Kgp's curricula”. The talk would be related to the speaker’s experience as the vice president of Gymkhana.
We hope to see you there with your friends!

Quiz Club

The Quiz Club,VGSoM is hosting its flagship quiz event Quizzario. The questions will be in relevance to the general quizzing ability of an individual.

Round 1:Written round, which will also be an elimination round, at VGSoM building.
Round 2: Top 6 teams will be shortlisted for the final round to be held immediately after the prelims.

Rules
Team should comprise of 2 individuals from the same department.
Only students enrolled in IIT Kharagpur, India are eligible
Prelims start at 2 pm, 25th March 2017.
A student cannot be part of more than one team
In case of any dispute, the decisions of VGSoM Quiz Club shall be binding
The format and rules of events are subject to change before the start of the event
Decisions by quizmaster and Quiz Club would be final and binding
There is no limit to the number of teams participating from a department.

Prizes worth INR 4.5k to be won!!

Registration Link : https://goo.gl/forms/BKrm...
On the spot registration is also available

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-03-2017 at 10:45PM
ProDex

Victor Hugo once said, "There is one thing stronger than all the armies in the world, and that is an idea whose time has come."
One such idea struck the mind of a second-year Biotech student in the march of 2012 and culminated in the form of ProDex. It was the idea that would give platform and voice to innovative Ideas of the students in the coming years. It's been five years since then, and it has given voice and opportunity to many students to express their thoughts and make their imaginations real.
We as a team have achieved a lot in these five years, but the importance of this journey does not lie in the past but in the achievements that will bless us in the times to come. There is no end to this journey, the journey is an end in itself.
Thanks, Jai Sankar for such a wonderful gift.
Thanks to our alumni for the help in the realization of this revolutionary idea.
At last thanks to the #TeamProDex for the efforts and dedication, you have been putting all these years.
#5YearsOfProDex

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-03-2017 at 08:30PM
Metakgp

Election results are here:

1. Naresh Ramesh : (Condorcet winner: wins contests with all other choices)
2. Nishant Nikhil : loses to Naresh R by 19–9
3. Ayush Goyal : loses to Naresh R by 18–10, loses to Nishant Nikhil by 14–13
4. Arun Patro : loses to Naresh R by 18–7, loses to Ayush Goyal by 16–11
5. Pranit Bauva : loses to Naresh R by 20–6, loses to Arun Patro by 15–12
6. Rameshwar Bhaskaran : loses to Naresh R by 22–3, loses to Pranit Bauva by 18–8
7. Sayan Sinha : loses to Naresh R by 22–3, loses to Rameshwar Bhaskaran by 14–9

29 out of 126 eligible voters casted their votes. The top three candidates,
Naresh R, Nishant Nikhil and Ayush Goyal will be maintainers of metakgp for
next one year, eight months and four months respectively.

Congratulations to new maintainers, we hope that metakgp will reach new heights under their leadership. Thanks a lot to all candidates who took out their precious time to participate in the election process.

BTW as a reminder to everyone, not being a maintainer doesn't stop you from taking initiatives. Metakgp is an open community, you can start your own projects, improve existing ones and make metakgp more awesome.

Please submit any (anonymous) feedback you might have about the election using this form https://docs.google.com/f...
and of course if you want to discuss something or just hangout with us, you can join us on our slack channel http://metakgp-slack.hero... /

  • View the post
  • Posted on 22-03-2017 at 04:46PM
CodeClub

Hey, everyone!

Mr. Robert Smith, co-founder & COO of infofree.com and Salesflower.com , one of the leading companies in US on sales leads, contacts and business solutions in this area, will be giving a talk on 22nd and 23rd on the below mentioned topics.

The schedule is as follows:
Talk 1: 22nd March 2017 (Wed, 6:30-7:30 PM)
Topic: The Dangers of Technology Frameworks
Speaker: Mr. Robert Smith
Audience: CSE/Maths (All students)
Venue: CSE Classroom CSE-119

Talk 2: 23nd March 2017 (Thu, 6:30-7:30 PM)
Topic: Wholistic Big Data in Business
Speaker: Mr. Robert Smith
Audience: CSE/Maths (All students)
Venue: CSE Classroom CSE-119

As part of your courses and general industrial experience, you will find these topics informant and extremely relevant. He is a person who has been at the helm of his companies where emerging technologies and develpment procedures using them are concerned. This will be a nice add-on to your Software Development and Database Course knowledge from the point of the industry, so do attend and bring your friends too.

Kharagpur Open Source Society

We had successfully conducted an introductory workshop on GSoC wherein we had invited speakers who were selected as students as well as mentors in GSoC. They shared their experiences, benefits, tips and advice on how to participate in the open source culture! Thanks to all of the speakers (Pranit Bauva, Himanshu Mishra, Avijit Ghosh, Nishant Nikhil, Sampad Saha, Anchit Navelkar, Shivam Vats, Ayush Pandey, Harsh Gupta, Pranay Yadav, Abinash Meher) as well as those who attended!

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-02-2017 at 07:15PM
Kharagpur Open Source Society

Greetings !

We are sharing the highlights from the GSoC session yesterday for those who could not attend. This[1] is the link of our presentation.

Please join Klug on Slack[2] by inviting your self from here - https://klug-slack.heroku...
Join the #gsoc channel and introduce yourself in a line or two. You can find a lot of GSoCers from KGP[3] over there, so don't hesitate.

We had mentioned about FLOSS Manuals[4] for the students. You must give this a read. It is written in a very simple and lucid manner and is one of the most useful resources for you right now.

You should also give a light read to a classic article on How to Ask Smart Questions[5]. And this is not just for GSoC !

And finally, here are a bunch of resources for you to learn Git[6], which you would be using later.

Email us or ask on KLUG slack for any help that we can provide. Do not hesitate. :)

[1] https://docs.google.com/p...
[2] https://klug.slack.com
[3] https://wiki.metakgp.org/...
[4] http://write.flossmanuals...
[5] http://www.catb.org/~esr/...
[6] https://docs.google.com/d...

Cheers !

  • View the post
  • Posted on 28-02-2017 at 06:30PM

  • View the post

Kharagpur Data Analytics Group

Kharagpur Data Analytics Group


Are you passionate about data science and applied mathematics? Did you feel that even though math was your strongest suit growing up, it was only an academic science and not applicable in real life situations?
All that has changed with the advent of data science and computing. And financial markets are one of the best places to learn and apply these skills.
P.S. : Look forward to lots of goodies and T-shirts
Date: 06:30PM
Time: 28-02-2017
Veunu: V-4 VIkramshilla Complex, IIT Kharagpur

Kharagpur Open Source Society


Yes, it is that time of the year again when you have to convert coffee to code. I hope you all know that Google Summer of Code is approaching soon and the Selected Organization list is going to be published on coming Monday.
Therefore, we are planning to conduct a seminar on how to overcome the initial barrier and we will also provide you a lot of insights about GSoC program by people who have cracked GSoC before as students and as mentors. The mentors will provide you even better insights of how they select students and much more stuff.
Thus we hope to see you for the GSoC seminar on Monday, 27th February 2017 at 6.30pm Vikramshila V4.
Cheers!
Date: 06:30PM
Time: 27-02-2017
Veunu: Vikramshila, IIT Kharagpur

  • View the post
  • Posted on 25-02-2017 at 02:10PM
Kharagpur Open Source Society

Yes, it is that time of the year again when you have to convert coffee to code. I hope you all know that Google Summer of Code is approaching soon and the Selected Organization list is going to be published on coming Monday.

Therefore, we are planning to conduct a seminar on how to overcome the initial barrier and we will also provide you a lot of insights about GSoC program by people who have cracked GSoC before as students and as mentors. The mentors will provide you even better insights of how they select students and much more stuff.

Thus we hope to see you for the GSoC seminar on Monday, 27th February 2017 at 6.30pm Vikramshila V4.

Cheers!

  • Posted on 03-02-2017 at 02:26PM
ProDex

Innovations are sparked only when we find ourselves facing the barrage of difficulties. We revved up our neurons to kick off 2017 by securing first runner-up in “R3 (Reduce, Recycle, Reuse)”.

R3 is a nation-wide Product Design competition conducted by Abhyuday, IIT Bombay. Three members (Aakash Patidar, Rajesh Prajapati and Harmanjot Singh Grewal) of Team ProDex made it happen. Our idea of a product named “WasteRover” : simple yet efficient automatic floating water waste collector was made up from everyday waste materials.
Our Product:

  • Posted on 30-01-2017 at 06:33PM
Autonomous Ground Vehicle

At AGV we make use of the latest technology to constantly push the frontier of research in Autonomous Cars in India. We are happy to present to you a view of the IIT Kharagpur campus you have never seen before.

Details for the nerds: These are images from a 3D Point Cloud map of the campus we generated with the Velodyne LiDAR. We will make use of the map to autonomously drive the Mahindra e2o car provided to us by Mahindra Rise.

Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group

Problem solving in complex domains often involves multiple agents, dynamic environments, and the need for learning from previous experience. Robotic soccer is an example of such complex environment.
"Code-O-Soccer", a simulation based strategic coding event, is back again to provide you the platform where you code the match strategy for a team of three robots and show your coding skills!
Prizes Worth - ₹50,000/-
Register at : http://ktj.in/#ktj/Events...
Find more details visit: www.ktj.in or http://event.krssg.in /
Join our Facebook forum to get the insight of the event. - http://tinyurl.com/code-o...
Submit your codes before 1st January, 2017

Kharagpur Data Analytics Group

Team “devenish-IIT-Kharagpur” ( Siddharth Muthukumar, Mohit Pokharna, Abhinav Agarwalla, Ishaan Sang) from IIT Kharagpur has made it into the top 20 finalists of Data Science Game 2016. They are representing India in the final round at Paris and will now be competing against Cambridge, Columbia, Stanford and other universites on 10th September.
We congratulate and wish the best of luck to the team devenish-IIT-Kharagpur on behalf of K-DAG.

  • View the post
  • Posted on 05-08-2016 at 12:17AM
Autonomous Ground Vehicle

Check out the exciting work we do at the Autonomous Ground Vehicle Research Group on our website, http://agv-iit-kgp.github...
Alternatively,
www.agv.iitkgp.ac.in

We would love to hear from students who find our work interesting and would like to contribute to the group (short term or long term).

We have an exclusive research environment in a state of the art lab where we work on advanced topics related to autonomous robotics (control, path planning, machine learning, mapping, navigation, image processing, mechanical design and analysis).

We are working towards our participation in the Mahindra Driverless Car Challenge, where we have been awarded a Mahindra e2o on clearing three rounds. We would be working on making this e2o a driverless car!

PS : IIT KGP 1st year students need not contact us, we will have separate selections during Feb 2017.
All others can send a message to this Facebook page.
